text: Can only recommend this place for a great ice cold beer but nothing more. Had the Nitro Nachos...eek, me thinks not! Poor quality ingredients. If they mess up nachos with simple ingredients what other harm can they do w/ the rest of their menu. Restaurant its self needs a little sanitizing & sweeping. I would feel bad about the glass my beer came in but they serve in red solo cups. First time I'm happy to see them.

You can skip this place for sure.  The food is overpriced and it really doesn't taste that great.  I definitely would not recommend this to a friend.  Just go around the corner as there are a lot of better options available in that immediate area.
Nice addition to the airport.  Carnitas tacos are the way to go.  Plus a nice pull up bar while waiting on a flight.  Don't forget the black beans & rice in the to go cup:)

Tasty drinks, good happy hour deals, upbeat atmosphere. Out of my handful of times eating here I've only had one issue with the food and the server said the head chef was out that night and "maybe the cooks are slacking" but that she'd talk to them. Nothing terrible, just carne asada and shrimp over cooked. Otherwise, every other time I've been there... on point!

Wow. Best airport food I've ever had. Had carnitas breakfast tacos on corn tortillas and they were absolutely delicious. Breakfast potatoes were kinda tasteless but tacos were excellent. Great mimosa too. Glad I was able to get one last mexican meal before heading back to the east coast.

We grabbed a bite before our flight, not knowing anything about the place. Mixed reviews.... the fish tacos were awesome! I really liked the overall flavor & how finely they shredded the cabbage. I am picky about my fish tacos. 

The nachos were pretty bare & the chips were rubbery. 

Would go back for the fish tacos, but that's all.

If you eat vegan food and you're stuck at the airport this spot has a tamale with green chiles & corn, the cheese is on top so they can easily leave it off. They also have black bean and rice burritos and tacos.

Love the taco Tuesday. Also they have craft beer and on happy hour that is awesome
It's close to home and I can walk in get seated and drink a cold one !
I had a tortilla soup and it was salty , and a hair came free ( in the soup). Little pricer for a cup of soup compared to other items.

Food, average. We had shrimp taco, beer battered fish taco and Nana's chicken taco which was the best of the three. I couldn't taste much flavors and I missed cilantro if there was any at all. We had both sides of charo & refried beans and plane Spanish rice: also missing any flavor and cilantro again. The chips and salsa was pleasant and so was the special $3 "finish your own" Bloody Mary. Kids meal was okay but also underwhelming; grilled chicken about plus about 10 French fries and a small cup of apple sauce covered in cinnamon. 
Overall everything was just OK or average nothing Wow'ed us to want to write a better review and/or return again.

This used to be our go to spot. I am not sure what the hell happened within the last month but it sure has changed. My gf sat at a table for over an hour and did not have anyone approach her table. An hour seriously? She ended up going to the bar to get a drink. She even went to the hostess twice asking for someone to help her. I showed up and had to wait 15 min and no one came over to help me either. Lots of people walking around which u didn't know if they worked there or not. Finally, my husband came in after finding a parking spot and ended up going to the bar to get us drinks. Then after flagging someone down to ask if he could help us he said he needed to see who was waiting on our section. He came back and said he could help us. Btw I ended up speaking to the operations manager and imposed the question.."does it normally take an hour to be waited on" in which he had a nice smart ass response im not gonna repeat. We finally ended up with a cool waiter which turned out to be way awesome but trying to get over the shitty service for the first hour and a half was a bit difficult. Well needless to say, we used to. Key word.. Used to love this place. Now I'm not so sure. I will be spending my money elsewhere because no one should have to wait an hour to be waited on! I'm not sure wtf they are doing there but with service like that they won't be having repeat customers.

I'm from Texas and have been to many upscale Mexican restaurants. This upscale urban Taco Garage has the feeling of a modern "Taco Shack" it immediately made me feel like I was on a beach. But enough about the "home run" hitting atmosphere. The tacos at this place are out of this world great. They make me feel like I could rise up to any occasion after eating. From breakfast tacos to quesadillas this place is a sure fire slam dunk. Not to mention their amazing Craft, Mexican, and domestic beer selection. You will never leave Sir. Veza's feeling hungry or thirsty. All around home run.
They have and amazing food and excellent customer service. Also if you follow on Facebook all kinds of deals plus music. This resturant was a fun place.
Johnnys the man ask for him food was bomb such a friendly guy first time here will be back for sure thanks Johnny

I guess I expect too much in the form of actual service. We sat for 10 minutes after order before reviving our drink order. The excuse was the bar was backed up. I'm literally counting customers- 5 at the bar and 5 tables. It's not busy and if the bartender can handle that load, she needs a new job. Food is average. I know I get jaded when the service sucks.
We had a fantastic time! Joe was our server and he was energetic and very friendly! I'll be back for sure.
Can clearly see warmer all food comes out of. Not impressed, and why an open kitchen with greasy walls? Nit appealing.

I have been here 3 times now for the Senoran Hot Dog, I would have to say the food is inconsistent. On a 1-10 scale my 1st visit for the Senoran Dog was an 8, the 2nd visit a 9, but the 3rd visit was only a 4. I'm not sure if I will be back after this as the hot dog tasted steamed not grilled, the charo beans were cold, and overall the ingredients just didn't taste fresh. I visited the location at 11am so it wasn't like everything was sitting out all day so I'm not sure what happened. I hoped for a good east valley location to satisfy the Senoran Hot Dog craving of the famous El Guero Canelo. Also some fresh salsa would be nice, not to sure why they provide pre-packaged salsa unless trying to go for the fast food thing. Have your servers fill some to-go cups with fresh made salsa, would probably be a lot cheaper too.

My all time favorite place to go during happy hour or work meetings. The staff is wonderful and super friendly,  the food is delicious & the drinks are amazing. I am very picky about customer service and this place by far exceeds my expectations. The bartenders are incredible at their jobs & the servers are always on top of things. But If you want to get the best service always ask for Dee she's the best and will make your visit that much better :)

Perhaps my expectations were too high; regardless, they were not met.  The girl working the bar had no business working the bar, but I suppose we all had to start somewhere.  Ordered one beer, got something totally different, and she never caught on despite several comments about it not being what was expected.  Food was okay (at the time*), but nothing to write home about.  Late-night happy hour specials (appetizers) were reasonable; normal prices compared to the food we got would be a bit high.  And if you wonder why the "at the time" comment, it's because I spent a significant amount of time on the toilet the next morning.  Pretty sure the food was the culprit, and the leftovers I brought home went straight from the fridge to the trash.
They did it up on decorations, and the bartender, Natalie, was great.  Terrific for an airport bar.
Tortilla soup and tacos VERY cheesy and salty. The place was a mess, nobody seemed to be cleaning anything up except me. I can stand the high prices but the quality wasn't there. Would not return.
Long wait on food, poor quality as well. Greasy , skip and hit up Dell taco. Kitchens dirty, and slow. I recommendation is to not bring family Here very irregular and confusing "style".

One of the worst dining experience I can recall. I had burger sliders. Had to come out of a microwave. Some of the fries we under cooked and some overcooked. My wife had a quesadilla that was average at best.

Been here quite a few times and have loved it! The atmosphere is great and the staff are so laid back and cool! I've always sat at the bar and they have always taken care of me! Definitely my new favorite spot! Try the chromeberry cocktail! So good!!
First timers from CA and we absolutely loved this place. Layne helped us and she was AMAZiNG!!

The decor is like being inside you or your dad's (maybe your mom's) garage. It's self-aware (daydrinking headquarters). and the drinks take up an entire 8x15 in. menu. The happy hour snacks and drinks are great price. They really know how to make a margarita pair with a chimichanga. Want a giant, oversized margarita with 4 straws for you and your friends? Done. Bacon wrapped chimichanga bites and jicima maple syrup? Weird but delicious. Unique, fun  and tasty.

We had a large group in the "Low Rider Room." Our server's name was Johnny and he provided great service. Everyone enjoyed their meals and look forward to returning. The Happy Hour Menu is one of the best around. The beer and tequila selections has something for everyone.

The service was pretty good. However, I ordered boneless wings and  they tasted like flavorless dried chicken breast instead of wings. The shape of the wings varied, which makes me wonder if they were wings.

PERFECT!
We're vegetarian... and it's hard to find GOOD Mexican food we don't make ourselves!  
Here, we can get tacos made to order, and crispy corn tortillas which melt in your mouth !  Love it!
Had the chicken tacos. They were not your ordinary tacos which was a good thing. Very good taste and only about 9 bucks. Service was quick to. Recommended

They have awesome gluten free wings! My wife and decided to share them. The cook accidentally threw some deep fried onion rings next to them and contaminated the order. So they gave my wife a whole new order and let me keep the old order. Then the manager came over to make sure we were okay and told us about their new line of gluten free beers. He gave us a freebie on the house! My wife loved it. It's called Dogfish Head Tweason Ale. Has hints of strawberry! The place was very good to us & we will definitely be back!
Had the Sinoran Dog. It was bomb!!! Like tick tick. Great place for my wife and I to go to...food is great and the whole menu can be made gluten free

First time I have ever posted a review on a place but this place made me do it. First time going with my fiance, looked like a chill spot. Sat down inside, kind of cool looking place but theme was a little confusing. Menu was an eyesore with the very different names for simple menu items. We both had a corona, almost not cold enough but not warm enough to complain about. Then we  both ordered carne asada burritos, mine was normal: hers was enchilada style. Server brings only my food out, then soon after hers came out. I take a bite of my burrito and I'm suddenly biting into a breakfast burrito. Server realizes mistake then comes and takes the plate back then has the nerve to go back to other table and grabs my order and tells me she cut it open but didn't take a bite. WHAT?? Why would i want food that has been cut open by someone else? Waited for food even though we were borderline gonna be late for our movie. Her food is now cold but I finally get my "new" burrito. So now we're rushed to finish. Both burritos were a little bland, hers was a bit more flavorful with the added sauce. Very Overpriced for quality of food. 15 dollars for a carne asada burrito? with no sides? The music was not good, way too loud, and clashes with the theme in my opinion. And the purpose of the uniform is to make sure the entire business/company looks equal/unified. Make the cook take off his "du-rag" and obnoxious hat. Just looks bad. I really hope this place turns it around because there is a glimmer of potential.

I never mind having to wait at Sky Harbor Airport. The restaurants and bars are generally amaizing, except for Sir Vesas. I wanted to have my lunch till after i passed through security. 
C18 is my gate. Although, living in Phoenix affords me great Mexican I have yet to get sick of good Mexican food. So when i ran across Sir Vesas i was excited. I ordered a carne asada salad. Wrong!. It was so disgusting. water on the  bottom, couldn't tell if the meat was chicken or beef. Gross!. I returned it with little push back. Got a fish taco instead. Again... gross! nothing authentic or good about this restaurant.  My advice... avoid it at all costs, the Zinc Brasserias customer service and food was much better.

I stopped in here for a bite on 1/22/14 at 3:19PM and ended up ordering one beef and one chicken taco to go.  Both seemed to taste ok but a number of hours later I had a very bad case of food poisoning that lasted about 24 hours.  Anyone that has been sick from food this was about a 7 or 8 on a scale with 10 being the worst.  I'm just not sure which taco it was that got me sick but it was either the chicken or the beef.  Beef and chicken seemed cooked as I recall.

I went the through the airport recently again and asked a shoe shiner about this place and that person suggested that it is known "not good" by the people that work in the terminal.  I would avoid.

I had only 1 place in Arizona to really enjoy a chili relleno, it's 3 hours away. I found out today, I only need to drive 5 miles to get an even better relleno!! Also, if you like spicy, get a Cheech and Chong margarita, extra spicy, delicious!!! Martisse will take good care of you, as well as all the staff. Excellent experience!!! My new favorite!!!

The atmosphere is great! The bartender was nice. The food was not too good. We just got nachos. The main ingrediant for nachos is cheese and it was horrible. It seemed like cheese whiz, yuk. It is very pricey, which we are ok with but not for cheese whiz. We ate at the bar and I did tell bartender i wash't happy with it. I complimented the shredded beef and guac. She didn't even offer to take a few dollars off b/c we weren't happy with the food. We love outside bars so much!! but sadly we probably won't go back. Just not good customer service. If I am paying 14.00 for nachos and don't like it and they don't care....equates to not going back.

OMG service above everything was awesome. Deena thought of everything for me  She's awesome. That made the food that much better 
Steak Fajitas and Sonoran dogs are incredible

I love this place. I like that it is family friendly. The service is great. The food is amazing. Everything I've tasted here was delicious. On Saturday nights they have a DJ who always plays great music and makes the atmosphere even more enjoyable. DJ shorty is the best. I will recommend this place to anyone who is looking for great Mexican food.

This restaurant at the Chandler mall has a great outdoor patio. Last night they had a DJ but there was hardly anybody in the restaurant.  I thought the food was good but not great.  Ice cold beer though.  All of the staff were very friendly and service was great.

First time in and experience was awesome! Not only was the food and drinks satisfying our server Meggan was on top of it. She was quick to give suggestions, attentive, and had a great sense of humor. Definitely going to recommend to friends!

Ordered a bean burrito, which says on the menu comes with beans, rice, and cheese. The not so friendly lady taking my order asked if I would like it plain. Unfortunately, my crazy mind assumed plain meant with nothing extra added.  I received my burrito with only beans, so I kindly went up to explain the situation to the girl who took my order. She said "you said you only wanted beans!" I replied "no you asked if I wanted it plain and I replied yes. I'm sorry for the miss understanding, but I'd like it with the rice and cheese please."  The cook quickly piped in "would you like me to make it extra special for him?"  Horrible, repulsive, inappropriate behavior. Never an apology and the food was ehhh.

5 stars for a few reasons. Awesome beer selection and I have 3 hours to kill. The food is well above average airport fare. If you have some time and need a good beer come here. Gate C12. It's worth it.

Joined a happy hour party here. This place was not my scene. I liked the feel of the restaurant with the big open walls to the outside. It's probably a better place for drinking then food. Had some seriously bad chicken, rubbery. Service replaced it quickly. My peeve is they bring these baby sized cups of chips out and your constantly having to ask for more chips which takes forever. It's not a total loss as a place to go. Drinks and appetizers are a great deal. Food wise there are other excellent Mexican restaurants in the valley better than this place. Still if your with friends and looking for a chill spot it's great for that.   Brett Russo

To be clear: I did not eat at Sir Veza's The Big Restaurant Attached To The Mall. I ate at Sir Veza's Taco Garage The Place In The Food Court Because I'm Cheap.

I'm not a business analyst, but what it looks like they've done is built their restaurant right next to the food court, so they share a wall, and then carved out one of the food court sections so now it's like the restaurant has a closet that they take orders from and bring you food. You can sit there, in the food court, with the rest of the food court eaters. The food wasn't super fast, which is great because that makes me believe they are making it fresh, and "ho doggy" it did seem to be pretty fresh. It wasn't slow either though. I didn't feel like I was sitting around waiting or anything. It took the appropriate amount of time.

I ordered a Sir Noran Hot Dog or something like that. I think the name is supposed to be a play on words because the name of the place starts with 'Sir', but I don't get it. It doesn't really matter though. I'm ok if they want to call it that. Anyway, I ordered it, and it was delicious. If you like hotdogs, you'll either like this, or you're a liar.

The ambiance of the food court in general is a wonderfully grounding experience. One of the things I love about the Chandler Fashion Square Mall is how diverse the shoppers are. You can sit in the food court for an hour, and absolutely make things up, and they'll inevitably walk through the place. Ugly kid on stilts. Totally overweight woman with 3 children. Guy who looks like the monopoly guy. Just any kind of person.

Overall I'm giving Sir Veza's Taco Garage a total of four freakin' stars, because the food was delicious, and the service was great, but compared to the cool taco-garage feel of the counter, going back and sitting in the mall food court means you don't get that full-on Sir Veza's experience. Well then, why did I eat at the food court instead of going to the restaurant? Well I'm not a genius, so I don't know. 4 stars is still really good, so don't worry about it.

Maybe I would rate it four stars if it was outside of the airport, but this is one of my favorite airport restaurants in the United states. Best fish tacos I've ever had, delicious tamales, and yummy churo bites. Definitely my go to place in terminal 4.

The young woman who took my order never smiled and acted like she was in pain. 

My chicken tacos were cold. 

When I requested replacements, the guy was incredibly rude. First, again - no smiling and no apology. He tried to argue with me that the small amount of sauce cooled them down. He realized I wasn't going to argue with him. So I looked up at the menu to remind myself what I didn't want on the tacos, he said to me, "look at me!" 

After I got the warm tacos, I told him I thought they should smile some and he wanted to argue again. Nope. 

The food was edible, but you couldn't pay me to eat there again.

very good food,better than I accepted. price of menu items are a little high but they make up for it with large portions. I had the most interesting vegetables in the world as an appetizer which was a mix of green and red peppers, onions, jalape√±o, broccoli, and pickles all fried in a tempura batter and served with a side of chipotle ranch! I also ate their carne asada tacos which where also very good. over all I would eat there again!

Waiting for my Southwest flight. Absolutely delicious and reasonably priced (especially for airport food). Good service and a fun atmosphere. Nothing like a Corona and a veggie bowl to relax before getting on the plane.

Overall our experience at Sir Veza's was very good. The kids actually ate their entire meals, which typically never happens. Kids meals are served in a compartmentalized tray, which is great for mine who don't like their different foods to touch. They have a wide variety of tacos, and I enjoyed each one I ordered - the short rib, the shrimp with sriracha; and the fish. However, I would definitely skip the table-side prepared guacamole for $10 - it was basically four lumpy avocados thrown together with some other minor ingredients mixed in. It was not terrible; just very bland and not worth the price. I liked the ambience of the place with the indoor/outdoor seating; and they had a DJ playing music outside on the patio on Saturday night. Like others have said, service was not great, but it certainly wasn't the worst I've had either...I assume this will get better with time. My family and I will be back to try out some different menu items, and to enjoy another cold MX brew out on the patio.

Let me start with the positive, cheap beer (for airports). It was about $5 for a craft 16oz beer, everywhere else is about $9 bucks. 

The food on the other hand was pretty gross. I got the burrito bowl and it was dry and 95% rice with a few pieces of chicken and a very small amount of sour cream and guac. Been stuck in the airport for much longer than I expected and I decided to try this because of the reasonably priced beer. Next door is the paradise bread (panara bread for socal folks) go there for food, way better food and better prices.

AWESOME doesn't come close! Love the way the girls and guys dress. The food is great especially the Carne Asada Taco's with their beans yummy! They have the tall beer that you can only order if there's 3 of you awesome if there is a group.

Second time here with disappointment.  I've decided to write about it this time.  The counter clerks are gabbing and joking while food is ready from the kitchen, but it just sits there.  

The sliders were as gross as they can get.  The texture was akin to boiled meat.  Maybe grill the meat or finish on an open flame? Duh. 

If you've got a lot of time and not jumping on a flight, I would only then give it a try because you'll likely return your food.

First off let me say I'm usually not one to give a bad review.... But this has to be said.



So I came with my family (mom,dad,sister etc.) It was our first time here. We walk in and it wasn't very busy so we were seated right away. Now the waiter was the main problem. He was maybe 23-25  and he looked like he was a meth addict. He was taking extremely fast, really jumpy, very very paranoid (he was always looking around like someone was following him) and he was always a scratching his wrist. He was nice but he made me extremely uncomfortable. The food was ok it wasn't anything special. Don't think we'll come back anytime soon.

I've never disagreed with a Yelp rating so much. Maybe people from Phoenix just have justifiably high standards when it comes to Mexican food. Maybe it's a service thing (although my service was great). Who knows. What I do know is that this place is super tasty and very reasonably priced. I got the chicken burrito for $10 and it's some of the best airport food I've ever had. Do yourself a favor and come in if you have a layover at PHX!
Honestly not that great of a place. Have not tasted the food but the drinks were not good. My suggestion is to go to kona right next door.

We want to give a BIG shout out to Marcus, we stopped in for some fish tacos and a fee beers after shopping and he was such an awesome server. We will come back since we received such great customer service from him. You Rock Marcus !

Melissa & Rocky

I had 2 Tacos... Beef and Chicken. Beef was ok... But the chicken and avocado combo really was amazing. Presentation and the decor is interesting.... Built like a garage as the name suggests. Music is fun and funky. Good place to hang out....
Good tacos and drinks. I come here almost every time I'm in town. Nothing fussy - just solid.
Service needs some work for sure! Tacos are okay nothing to rave about. The best thing about Sir vezas are the nachos, ceviche and drinks!!

This restaurant is the best "garage" ever!  
Most of the staff is incredibly friendly and welcome you as you walk past. 

Decor is all moto... Shop rags for napkins, wheels for the base to booths, drop-light lighting, wrench chandelier, truck and motorcycle parts on the walls & ceilings, side mirror collage over sink basin, and the list goes on.  So very creative.    
Big screen TVs everywhere for the sports fans.   
The food is a mixed lot.  
First visit we ordered nachos... Thankfully only one order as they serve a HUGE amount.  (Seriously 1/4 sheet cake piled high). We chose the pork with prickly pear salsa and the meat was melt in your mouth perfection.   

Second visit I had the best hamburger that I've eaten in years.   No bun, but they do offer Gluten Free buns. Woohoo! Drag strip chicken was pretty good, dredged in corn flour, no wheat!!  Hubby had chimi, again like the nachos, the portion is HUGE.  ( good for a big dude )

The fries were undercooked and a little cold, but have potential.   

They were out of their "special" (cannot remember what it was that day).  Good thing they have plenty to choose from.   And GLUTEN FREE options.  Which is good for those of is with intolerance or mild allergies.   I hope they are successful and stay!!!
Great food their table side guacamole  is really good as well as the tacos. We come here quite often and our server joe is always Great! They also have some of the best micheladas.

Best sports bar/ restaurant in Chandler. Great TVs with volume for events. They play great music and have live music as well. The food is absolutely awesome also very good variety. They also have the best Happy Hour in town. My friends and I now have a new place to have fun and enjoy great food and taste lots of crafty beers.

Loved the idea of a garage restaurant.  We stopped in for lunch after shopping for hours. We got the T bucket sampler: it did come in a bucket, but everything in it was fried-which made it all taste the same.  Watching other things come out of the kitchen-their portions are large.  We Really loved the chips and salsa, but not sure if that's enough to come back for.
Sliders were crap... Tamale was dry and lacking flavor and the waitress was one of the rudest people Ive ever encountered at an airport

I've had two meals here, both were tasty. They clearly label their menu indicating gluten-free options. As GF people know, most Mexican food is naturally GF.  But it's nice to know that the kitchen is attempting to eliminate contamination. The location is right next door to Cartel Coffee by the high C gates. They have a seating area and a TV. Carry out business is pretty quick. The salsa comes on the side in containers, red and green. Burrito bowl was flavorful and a good portion size for me.

Meh...
Their quest takes like nacho cheese sauce you get at the ball park.  
The chimi bites had the same cheese sauce in them, but with green chiles added.  
And I'm not even a picky eater.  But they should market more towards a Wendy's or Burger King patron

I have written about this place once before and the second time we went almost a year later is NO better.....
Waitress sara greeted us, it took another 10 minutes to take our order and she was no where to be found. Don't know the guys name but he deserves 5 stars and he took our order, made our apetizer made sure our food came out right and had to catch a ride. We tipped him. Manager asked if food was ok and before I or my husband or friend could ask anything, basically ran away. She asked if we needed anything else, we said boxes and the check please. She brought boxes and asked if we wanted dessert. I'm a server myself, I know the deal, if I ask for a check it usually means I don't want dessert. We asked for the check a SECOND  time and she comes back saying "I don't know what you ordered since I didn't take your order so how do you want me to split it". 
Seriously, in my 11 years of serving I have never, NEVER, said that to a table.....
Also to include the last time we were there the manager told the server that if she wanted an amount taken off the bill SHE WOULD HAVE TO PUT HER OWN HARD WON TIPS TOWARDS IT EVEN THOUGH IT WASN'T HER FAULT THAT OUR FOOD CAME OUT AT DIFFERENT TIMES ALONG WITH OUR APETIZER COMING OUT THE SAME TIME AS OUR BILL! 
This place pissed me off again and I will never go back unless they hire ppl who are willing to work and actually make sure their tables are ok.

Yumm! We had the shrimp diablo taco (hubby said it's a definite repeat next visit) - I enjoyed the grilled fish & grilled chicken tacos... drinks were excellent (& BIG!) - great service & comfy outdoor seating.
Food was terrible.  Hostess had a bit of an attitude.   Our Server was nice.   Drinks were ok.   We won't be going again.

Reliable food typically overpriced. Don't expect any of the servers to go above and beyond to make you a satisfied customer. If you're good with the minimum work they'll do, definitely stop here to help a rumbling tummy.

Stopped here unexpectedly while shopping. 11:50 am with only 1 other table seated, (oh No). Like some other reviews outdoor furniture in rags, not very warm welcome. But it was Tuesday 1/2 price tacos, so why not. Our food arrived very quick and was actually very good, the chicken and beef tacos very moist. Large portions, the server actually warmed up to us after our meal casually visiting with us??? I would try again.
Meggan and Nate had wonderful service! :) they were very prompt and our meal was delish! It's our favorite place for Taco Tuesday!

Absolutly discusting. Way over priced even for airport food. Staff was not very friendly and where just kind of hanging out.. Seating is tight and does not allow for any dinning enjoyment.. Had chicken quesadilli and chicken was hard and rubbery probably from being over cooked.. Choices are limited in this terminal, so if you have time maybe explore others.. Better yet, stop at subway and grab a sandwich for your bag..

I needed a good breakfast while waiting for my flight. Enter Sir Vesa's! The breakfast tacos and breakfast scramble hit the spot. It wasn't fancy, but the no-nonsense breakfast is exactly what I needed. I'll remember this place the next time I'm in Sky Harbor.

First time here and HOLY HOT DAAAMMM!! This place Rocks! It has a car garage character, and I'm a car guy so thumbs up. The original plan was to just to shop around in the mall real quick, and decided to have a quick beer since I was Hangry. 

Then guess what?  Ordered one drink called the Sirchelada. Don't know what it is? Come try it. Well one great drink led to another, you know how it goes. Then for the snacks. Rocket edamame sure is fire. Lift off.

This was a short trip but definitely will be back for more.

It's so rare to get good airport food. My fish tacos here were delicious. Perfect portion and tasted so fresh. My husband had the nachos and he was happy too. Plus the fountain drinks are free refills and the staff were super nice!
I'm accustomed to airport food being expensive, but even by that standard this was disappointing for a $14 chopped salad.

Good music, great atmosphere, and our waiter was very sociable. They have a vegan option on the menu which is always nice. I ordered the chicken burrito and a mixed berry margarita which were both delish.
Decent burrito, for an airport. Barbacoa was actually pretty tasty but the size left me wanting more to eat.

We had went there this evening, we sat on the patio area(for 2 hours), me, my husband and daughter, first I would like to say this used to be our favorite place to go to, as of tonight I would like to say I don't think we are going back, we didn't have the greatest service, we walked in thru the patio area, a waitress "asked us if we wanted a few menus" as we were already seated(which was nice of her). Our server came and took our order, she was nice, brought us water, I did assume that they stopped serving chips and salsa as we did not get any with our water like we used to get when we used to go before, but then I saw every table around us that got them, even the people at the bar. My husband ordered the Street Corn, without Tajin on it, he doesn't like tajin, (the server that asked us if we wanted menus is the one that ended up bringing my husbands corn out to him, and it had tajin, he told her that he did order it without it, she grabbed it, and said oh ok, we can get you a new one, which was nice, but then walked away and rolled her eyes, she was kind of a snob) we could of done without the eye rolling, not my fault she doesn't like her job, it would of been a little better. Also when we order beer a tall one, you might as well order a regular one, all the beers for some reason we're at least 2-2 1/2 inches away from being full from the top of the glass, why is that. My Nachos, that's another story, I don't know where I've ever gone some where and had cold Nachos where the cheese was not melted? Here's a tip, you guys should put the meat beans and cheese on them and broil them and then out the other toppings on, that's just an idea, and less water in the pico and warm the meat up too please. My Sir Chelada was good like always. But this time was a disappointment overall.

My husband and I tried this restaurant with reservations, since there were mixed reviews. We are pretty hard to please and we were pleasantly surprised by our experience.  I feel like this restaurant hasn't been given enough credit.  

We arrived mid-day on a Sunday after a few hours of shopping.  The beer was cold and the wine was nice.  The chips and salsa was very flavorful and great to take the edge off our hunger.  Our waitress was very helpful and friendly and recommended the tacos to us.  

My husband had the cerveza battered fish, the shredded beef and diablo shrimp tacos along with rice and beans.  He had both corn and flour tortillas.  The tacos were very generous in size and they used two tortillas per taco (they were smaller).  The flavor was very good for each of the proteins and cooked well.  I had the diablo shrimp and shredded chicken on a lettuce wraps, which was a nice option for a person who likes to each low carb and watches their macros.  

Overall, the place had a fun atmosphere, the service was good and the food was flavorful. We would come here again and recommend that people give it a try!

Needed to grab something eat before I hopped on my flight but wanted something other than pizza or a pre-wrapped sandwich. Stumbled upon this little place and ordered the Chicken & Bacon Quesadilla. Great flavor and the perfect size. Came with just the right amount of guacamole. Overpriced but that's what you get when ordering food in the airport. Definitely would come back next time I'm in Phoenix's airport.

I've never written a yelp review but I feel this place needs to hear it as a former bartender and waitress I get sometimes you get busy but this was pure laziness.  I wanted to come for a celebration with family and friends and everything was HORRIBLE and made the night not what you want for celebrating. 1st the hostess with a huge attitude and extremely RUDE didn't have my reservation for 15 people but luckily there was plenty of space on the patio. After we finally got seated it took me after about 15-20 minutes of patiently waiting to get up and ask a sever if we could get service.  
     2 of the 3 people that chose to order food never got it because the order was never put in.  I had to constantly find our server to keep drinks full, remind them what they forgot or ask for it to be made how we ordered it,  at one point I ran my own drinks from the bar that sat there for a good 10 minutes while the "manager" was behind the bar just washing dishes. While I also watched my 2 servers standing by the POS stations .. 
     Lastly my bf and I sat down at the bar after everyone else left to have a drink together n couldn't get acknowledged yet alone service so we went over to BJS n got great friendly service..  Compltely ruined my experience and celebration. I've been here before and had bad service like this but just chalked it up to its a new place they need time, well this was the last time I or anyone of the 15 people who came to Sir Vezas last night will be back or spend our money there. I hope they find good help that cares and knows what they are doing..
The shrimp tacos are the best ever! Great atmosphere and excellent service! Love the outside seating!

This is one of those "if I could give it 0 stars..." reviews. To Cruella, or whatever your name was, it's not my fault the girl that took my order told me I could get the sliders wrapped in lettuce (instead of a bun). I even got charged for extra lettuce. I waited patiently for my food, got called up, and was given a burrito. 

When I explained what I ordered, this extremely rude Phoenician said, in a snotty tone, "We don't make that." Uh, well perhaps you should tell the girl that took my order at YOUR "restaurant." She talked to me like it was my fault I dared order that. She then tersely says, "Do you want to order something else or do you want a refund?" I was like, "Hey, stop flirting, you're making me blush!" No, not really.

So I said to just do the sliders with the buns. She was multitasking spreading her sunshine to others, so I'm not sure if she heard me. She then walks away for 5-10 seconds, just leaving me at the counter alone. She finally comes back and says, "What do you want to do?" I'm thinking, "I'd like to recommend a career change, for one. It's not my fault you probably go to Arizona State and work at the airport in food service. How about something where you can scare children or don't have to deal with customers, like bomb diffuser. I think some Phoenix passengers would appreciate that." But I digress.

She was really rude. I went to McDonald's and got a lettuce wrapped QPC and it was delicious for half the price.

We were out shopping at the mall and decided to stop in here for an early dinner. We came during happy hour, so of course my hubby had to try a margarita! It was a blackberry margarita and it was very tasty (I had more than one sip lol) 

My daughter ordered the kids burger which was decent, and my hubby and I shared the nachos. They were HUGE! Plenty of food for two people to share as a meal. The nachos were very good, but not the best I have ever had.

The best part of our meal was our server, De. She was super friendly, knowledgeable, engaging, and speedy! All the things I like in a good server. 

We will definitely go back again!
A little high on the price but worth it. I've been here twice. First time I had a burger and fries. Outstanding! Second visit was boneless wings with diabolo sauce. Amazing!!

It's not the worst option for fast food style airport food. They have veggie tacos that provide reasonable portions and nice scoops of guacamole. The rice is awful and the salsa is more like pizza sauce. Although it's affordable and quick.

I LOVE THIS PLACE! I have been here three times now with the boyfriend and family and everyone loves it! They have a great beer selection and the service is always good, the waiters aren't in your face too much or not enough it's the perfect amount & of course the atmosphere is great too! Highly recommend the Sonoran Dog, it's presentation is on point and super filling! I've gotten both their tacos and shredded beef burrito (fully loaded) and never been disappointed! Would HIGHLY recommend this place to anyone!

Tried Sir Veza's this evening with my husband.  The staff was very nice and accommodating.  The food was great-i did not get what I ordered,  but it was still awesome.  I ordered the club taco and the Diablo chicken taco,  and I got  a plain chicken taco and a Diablo shrimp taco.  Both were really good though,  and I didn't even mention it to the waitress.  

We also had the Margarita of the month that has coconut in it,  which was delicious!!  

The food was a little slow to come out,  especially for a Thursday,  but thankfully we weren't in any hurries.  

Overall,  it was good food and drink.  I would absolutely give them another try

I was extremely disappointed when I arrived at the garage today. I went to order the Prickly Pear BBQ tacos that I am in love with...only to find out that they don't have them anymore.  My server, Bobby, went up and above the call of duty to get the kitchen to make them for me. I will definitely be back because of him! He's also super hot, so that's a plus!!

Whoever designed this place should be institutionalized. Every space is so narrow that a single person blocks it off, let alone when they're dragging along children with their own bags. There's so few surfaces on which you can lay down your meal that people were literally eating over garbage cans. I had to sit there and wait, being pushed and bumped around like a buoy, as the stench of putrefying tacos wafted out of everywhere.

The salad, much to my surprise, had potential. The combination of ingredients was great, but completely spoiled by a dressing that tasted like a melted lemon-lime popsicle.
Horrible food and wayyyyyy overpriced, even for an airport. Horrible customer service. All the employees seemed angry. The guacamole was God awful!

I tried the car club chicken tacos with corn tortillas and it was amazing! They were bigger than I expected them to be for being corn tortillas. We went back for taco Tuesday and got the 2 dollar happy hour tacos. They are pretty small but good. It was a nice surprise to see four peaks peach ale on tap since usually places only have kilt lifter. I will be back for sure. Nice to have this place close by.

I absolutely love the Diablo shrimp tacos from here, I mean seriously I crave them. Anyway my wife and I came by yesterday for a lunch date and both ordered 3 tacos, she ordered Nana's chicken, carnitas and carne asada tacos. The Nanas chicken taco was amazing, the other 2 were good as well, but the chicken was far and away her favorite. I ordered the Diablo shrimp, the vegetarian taco, and the chicken club taco. The Diablo shrimp was super delicious as always, sweet and spicy, with shrimp that are crispy on the outside and perfectly cooked on the inside. The vegetarian taco was actually a bit of a surprise in how good it actually was. Super fresh tasting, with an awesome garlicky cream sauce and crispy fried avocado it's going to become a regularly ordered item for me. The chicken club however was just blah to be honest, nothing bad about it, it just didn't impress the way the other two tacos did. We really enjoyed our food, but as others have said, the service was definitely lacking. It took our server 15 mins AFTER we had gotten our margaritas to offer us water as well, and she didn't check in after we had gotten our food, she was no where to be found when we were ready for the check, and it really wasn't busy...we were one of 5 families at the restaurant. But otherwise the food was great as usual!

We had such high hope for this place based on the beer list and the menu but . . . Epic fail. The bland appetizers were served by a visibly sick waiter, the beer we wanted was unavailable, and the service was. . . Very . . . Slow. Fortunately, there are a lot of great places in the immediate vicinity.

Went for the company and I stayed for the food. 

We started with the guacamole and had the server be the "diver" (her term not mine). Most times they drop off the guac fixins and the table makes it to their taste. Overall the freshness was on point and it tasted good. 

For my entree I ordered the shrimp enchiladas. I tired to stop eating it half way through.....I even put my sour cream side cup in the middle of the dish in hopes they would take it.....moral of the story is good food won. I ate every bite. 

We did have to ask for more chips and salsa on multiple occasions. It wasn't the best Mexican food I had in AZ but it was good considering it was attached to a mall.
Not bad in fact good. Great service at the bar. Good food, excellent beer selection. I enjoyed the time there with a beer and quesadillas - enjoyable. Keep it up a welcome addition to sky harbor

This spot was 15 feet away from the gate and I wanted a burger.
I ordered the two sliders with fries. It was reasonably priced at $10. 
The first thing I noticed was the burger meat was not made fresh. Even though it was good, I could tell that it was not made when I ordered it and when I opened up my container there were only about 14 french fries, I expected more. Even though I got gypped on the french fries, they were really good. Perfectly seasoned with salt and pepper.

I ordered:
-two beef Tomales
- their *world famous* sirnoran dog(which I had a feeling was a marketing ploy)
-and a pumpkin tomale (we were lucky to get this seasonal item).

The beef Tomales were sub pare, the flavor just wasn't there in a the masa.
The sirnoran dog was a let down the flavors didn't work, the old school fries that came with it tasted like they were in the freezer for to long, the pepper was good though.
The pumpkin tomale was a steamed pumpkin pie filling in masa wi th whipped cream, it turned out to be pretty good and was the only saving grace.  Don't think I'll  eat here agian.

The food was good for what it was the atmosphere of the restaurant was good. We didn't get service for like twenty minutes when we got up to leave the host was very concerned got us service and the waitress on her second day was amazing she made up for the wait and helped us was cheerful kind and the staff made for a good experience. I will be back again.

Our first time here at Sir Veza's and we had a great experience. Our waitor Joe was friendly and helpful! He recommended the lunch special, different types of specials and spicy mango margarita! Everything was delicious! He was very thoughtful that he even packed our food to-go and iced cold water! We are definitely coming back for the food and great customer service.

I got a vegetarian bowl, it was simple but actually pretty tasty. I'm giving them 2 stars because I hate styrofoam, and I think it's especially inappropriate if you're going to sell a "bowl." Styrofoam is toxic to us and the planet. If they rectify this they'd getmore stars from me, but I will never return to a restaurant that serves me in styrofoam.

Over the top great service!  We received excellent service while eating dinner here on a Monday night.  The food was great and the drinks were outstanding.  

The service

It is nice to eat a restaurant and have a server who knows about the menu and what it tastes like.  We got great info when placing our drink order and then our food order.  We never waited a minute if we needed something.  The chips and salsa were replaced when they got low.    

The atmosphere 

We ate outside under the large mall entry way covering.  It was comfortable and was good for people watching in the background.  I did mention we ate here on a Monday night and the large screen television allowed us to watch some of the game(even though we both didn't like the teams playing LOL)  

The food

I went with a 3 taco plate and tried 3 different tacos.  It was served with beans and rice.  All three were good and my favorite was the diablo shrimp taco.  My wife had the grilled chicken enchilada flat.  We both thought the food was very great.  I was just able to "just' finish everything on my plate and my wife wasn't.  We both left full!  

Overall

Having been to the Tucson locations this new one in Chandler is on par with the others.  I had a great tasting margarita and enjoyed the chips and salsa while waiting for our food.  When the food arrived it tasted great.  The automotive garage theme they have going on works.  Outside dining and the ability to watch the game worked.  With the amount of quality food and drink we got the price worked.  If you find yourself wanting Mexican food while at the mall give it a try.  It will not be the typical mall fast food and the quality here will be much better!
Good flavored tacos at a fair price for a airport food court. Fast service and a good selection of beer on tap.

Staff was super friendly.  Ordered the Burrito bowl.  Ugh.  Seriously gross.  I LOV E  Mexican food and will eat ANYTHING.  This was just bad.  Granted, a bit late at night but please do not scrape up the crusty rice that has been in the pot all day and add it to the meal - and sauce wayyy too salty.  But hey, there are no options.  If you have an option, take the drinks, skip the food.

I was at the mall and it was unbelievable! The fries are amazing!! They were fried mash potatoes! This place better make it cuz this place is way better than kona grill! The atmosphere was cute and unique and the food was amazing!

As a usual customer of sir vezas, I am very disappointed in my experience today. The bar was extremely under-staffed with only one girl running the entire bar area and making all of the drinks for the entire restaurant. It took 40 minutes for us to get our drink order and our appetizer was completely forgotten about. I hate to stop going to a place after one bad experience but today was too much. The only reason we would consider returning is for our usual good experiences with the bartender with pink hair, she is so awesome and they need more of her in this place.

I love this place and look forward to lay overs at Sky Harbor just so I can get some Mini Chimi Bites and then there is the staff, they're great.  Today was no exception. Fallon was super nice and made sure my stop was excellent. Good food, good service and good prices what more could you ask for?

We got the chips and queso!
And we got the guacamole and chips!
Sounds great right?!?!
Nope...
Never again!
$15.00 later we got 2 boxes of chips, a tiny salsa cup of guac and nacho cheese drizzled on our chips. 
Way to swindle your customers SirVeza's!
Hours are not correct. They stop serving food much earlier. Called to find them the never said anything about kitchen being closed. Finally got there and they don't server food.

Best patio I've been to in a long time. Weather was perfect, company was wonderful, food was awesome and service was great. We spent several hours just hanging out, drinks, appetizer, lunch, dessert. Colby, our waitress was a perfect hostess even with all the special requests we made. We plan to make this a regular weds lunch spot. Their nearly endless list of taco recipes, and the amount of beers they offer was inexhaustible. Yep, love this place!

So,  we habe been here once before when it very 1st opened. I was relatively uncomfortable at that visit as all the servers looked like strippers, and can't remember much of the food...HOWEVER,I wanted to give it another chance,  and this time was different! All the servers were dressed and of different body types! The food was delicious.  Hubby got the shredded beef bowl,  and I tried a bowl as well! Yum,  and plenty left over. They have a great kids menu too! We used the check-in offer for a pumpkin tamales, but they were out so they substituted it with fried ice cream which comes with churros! Amazing!!!!
grilled fish tacos with shredded cabbage were quite good, for food in an airport..
Seriously this place is amazing! This is exactly how food should be made. The nachos with pork and prickly pear sauce are incredible.

First time here and the food was very good. My girlfriend and I will definitely come back, our server Katie was awesome and very helpful with what is good here. We had the T-Bucket sampler bucket was more then enough food for the two of us. The restaurant was decorated very nice and it was very clean.

The Sonoran hot dog was okay however mine was on the weak and empty side... see my picture. Hardly worth $10 for this... go get a real Sonoran hot dog for less that is more fulfilling.  Disappointing.
Probably the best tacos I've ever had in my life! The Diablo shrimp is the greatest thing ever!!! I don't think I've ever had a bad experience here.
Matt was great! Stopped for a cold one and some jams !!! Recommend for a hang  out with friends on a Friday night.

This place was pretty terrible. Only went because we had a groupon, server did a good job but the food was terrible. They had a DJ at 4 in the afternoon on a week day, it was just all around bad. Perhaps a better option for the younger crowd that needs to feel like they are in a night club. Won't be back.

I stopped in while waiting for a flight.  Initially it was packed but luckily everyone's flight must have been leaving at the same time and cleared out in time for me to get a seat at the bar.  I ordered the chicken burrito bowl which consists of black beans, sv rice, queso casero, bowls guacamole, roasted corn, pico salsa.  Very tasty, light enough that I didn't feel sleepy after I ate it.  They serve mixed drinks in the "red" cup that you see at most parties, just to give you that additional "garage" theme feel.  Bill aka Preston is a funny and well engaging bartender!  They should give this guy a raise!  So quick, thorough and attentive I love it!

Stopped here today for a quick lunch during a 2-hour layover at PHX. I got a grilled chicken taco on a flour tortilla, minus the queso and beans, and a shredded beef taco on a corn tortilla. I had figured the corn one would be a hard shell but it was actually soft shell. 

The tacos were pretty good, a little pricey (around $11-12) but that's typical for airport food. It has a limited seating area but I found a seat at the bar, there are a few tables to sit at as well.

The only reason I gave 2 stars is because the food tasted fair. Although, the portion to price was offensive at best. I felt compelled to speak to the manager hoping that there was a mistake. When I she treated me like the fool who just got duped and there wasn't a thing she was about to do about it. Nice managerial skills. Then, while my family was still eating, a server came up to our tiny table and dropped off the condiment bucket that we had removed to accommodate our meals and said "Be sure to put back the condiments when you are done!" She didn't even ask us the cursory, "How's everything?"
OFFENSIVE--RIP OFF--RUDE.
Save yourself the abuse and go elsewhere. Good luck, descent people.
Taco Tuesday special is amazing, and our server was great. The food was delicious, but the sangria was terrible.  A regular lite beer would have been a better option at a reasonable price.

I give this place no stars really we waited at door for a long time to be seated.  The hostess was very nice when she did get there.  We sat for at least 10 minutes before we got up and walked out.  Five severs came around us none of them even offered us water or looked at us sad service.  We just went to BJs down the way where their costumer service is wonderful.  So much for trying someplace new :(

Just opened up at the Chandler mall, you'll find this sports bar at the food court entrance.

The menu is written in car jargon and difficult to understand,  but our server was polite and helped explain the different items. Food and drinks were over priced. The happy hour specials are closer to normal prices.

Seating was...interesting. The dining area is mostly outside and set up like a bar rather than a restaurant. There is also a 'lounge' area with cushioned benches and coffee tables. At the dining tables, you get either a bench seat, stool, or horribly uncomfortable chair. I had to swap out my chair for a stool shortly after being seated, and I noticed another lady also opting for a different seat.

I have to say, after seeing the high prices I was prepared to dislike this place, but we really got our value for the food we ordered. Three of us shared a full order of nachos with chicken, and it was super huge and we all loved it. Just for the nachos, I would come here again. Seriously, this thing was served on a baker's 1/4 sheet and was 8" high!!

Service was a mixed experience but mostly good. At one point I went inside for something I needed. I surely had an I-need-help look on my face but thought there were employees everywhere,  they were so focused on watching the game on TV I had trouble getting someone's attention. In a few minutes I got sorted out and went back to the mountain of nachos at my table.

Overall a good experience.

Food: we got the Carne Asada burrito - fully loaded (rated 3 stars... It was OK... Nothing special) and the Diablo Shrimp bowl (4 stars)... The Diablo shrimp is kind of like an orange chicken I would say (a little spicy, but also sweet). 

Service: not the best - I had asked for more salsa before our food came and she never brought it out then I needed a knife for my bowl (our waitress didn't bring our food) so I waited a few minutes before getting up and finding her to ask for a knife and the salsa. 

I do love the gluten free options here. They really cater to that, it seems, and the servers are well-informed, which is great. They said the chips have a dedicated fryer (not fried with the cerveza-battered fish, etc.) and I haven't gotten a reaction yet so crossing my fingers on r

Worst dining experience in a while, and I recently ate at a Chili's. It started out okay we got seated quickly but that's the only kind thing I can say. Our waitress disappeared so often we had to ask two other people to look for her. And then had to wait 15 more minutes before she showed. She brought us the wrong drink and after offering to discount it, the manager came and told is he couldn't, we let it go just so we could get out of there. The appetizer was terrible and we would've tried something else except, you guessed it, our waitress had vanished into the ether. It's not worth sweating your ass off in steel seating. Trust me.
Ladies margaritas $1 on Mondays! They definitely have the best happy hour in town! Love this place!

We visited a few weeks ago.  My daughter ordered a kid's meal, which was actually served on a school lunch tray and was just as flavorful.  My husband ordered 2 street tacos which were greasy (they had been grilled with cheese unlike most street tacos) and served with mediocre sides of black beans and rice.  My meal was the most tolerable, but only because I requested no cheese or dairy of any kind.  I had to wait longer as they remade my meal, because they made a mistake and originally put cheese on it.  I also had a margarita, which was watered down.

Given the poor food quality, I don't expect this restaurant to last much longer than others that have been at the spot.  But if you are at the mall and looking for "Mexican" food, I suggest Rubio's - it's much better than this place.
I felt like I was eating Mexican food in Kansas.  The salsa was straight out of a jar, and nothing else was any better, including the lousy $10.00 margarita!

I'm racing through the airport starving and hoping not to miss my flight.  For one time in my life I was happy my flight was delayed.  I had an extra hour and stumbled across this place. I ordered the carne asada burrito no rice, I honestly was expecting a not so good burrito because I'm in an airport.  I was wrong!  This place was fast, friendly and the meat in the burrito was amazing.  I ordered with hot sauce and it was kind of weak.  But overall really good quick food.

Worst bar concept ever.  No matter what drink you order be prepared for it to come in a plastic red cup. The gimmick is wasteful and pointless.  The bar doesn't provide for recycling even though the hundreds of plastic cups it throws out everyday are marked for recycling.  This place needs to get over the "red cup" trend and get into the now.  Very disappointed in the cliche.  Thankfully there are a couple other more respectable bars just a five minute walk away.
Great Micheladas and Bloody Marys.  Tacos are a solid 10 and portions are not skimpy! Great atmosphere and staff was great.  Definitely one of my favorites in Chandler.

Extremely overpriced burritos that are small in size & have hardly any filling in them. $12 Carne Asada burrito that was mostly filled with black beans. It would take two burritos to constitute a meal. Complete rip-off, even for airport price-gouging.

Even if this wasn't airport food, this place would be pretty good.  Think of it as a more expensive chipotle (minus the E. coli).  I got the shredded beef bowl for $10 and was pleasantly surprised.  Also, guac is included, so kudos for that.  Wait time was also shorter than most other airport options.  We were lucky enough to snag a seat, but tables are limited.

I tried this place at the Phoenix Airport.  I ordered the Veggie Bowl; imagine my surprise when the only veggie was one very small slice of onion - I'm serious - that was it!  Approximately 10% of the rice was so hard it was not chew-able.  I'll never eat there again.
I don't have a whole lot of expectations from airport restaurants but serving raw fish would still catch me off guard. The fish was not properly thawed and was tasteless on top of being raw.

I am a fan of the burritos here. It's great place to grab a bite inbetween flights. The burritos are always fresh tasting and delicious. You choice your filling and they do the rest. The salsa is really good here too. 

The service is quick, friendly, and efficient and you can also order a beer here too, winning...

The seating can be tricky, as there is not much. However, with all patrons on the go, be patient, wait a few minutes, a table will most likely open up for you soon. There is also a counter to stand at to enjoy your meal here too, just another option. 

I will keep coming back, you bet.
Delicious burritos bowls and burgers, great drinks, Paleo and GF friendly! Well worth checking out.

I've searched long and hard to find good beer in terminal 4.  Santan Hopshock on tap, Four Peaks Hop Knot in cans, Sleepy Dog on tap.  Awesome!  And not 9 dollars!    4 stars because without having the food I can't give 5.

Food was great.  I had chicken tacos, custom to my preferences.  It's a cramped restaurant so if you are just eating...go somewhere else. Michael is behind the bar and though I was not drinking he was still there for service.  Plus he's suprr personable and a nice guy. I'm a fan.

So this is the 2nd time I've been here and while the first time had mediocre service, our waiter Matthew was ON POINT. We never had an empty beer, empty chip or salsa bowl. The food was great but the service was even better, Matthew was attentive and courteous, his walk by and thumbs up or down was perfect to keep the ambiance flowing (interrupting yet totally not!). Thank you for he amazing service Matthew, will totally come back and ask for you!!

Not much to say except for almost no flavor chicken with edible black beans and pretty fluffy edible rice. The veg and onions are way too soft, almost mushy. The guac is edible and the pico de gallo did not look fresh. They also give you a side of spicy salsa that's full with preservatives. 

Edible when you're on a bind.

My friends and I love the happy hour discounts on the 120 oz beer towers of bluemoon for $29 and any others for less! The burgers are amazing! and especially the t bucket sampler, ever need a fun place in chandler to hangout at? come to this location at chandler mall the whole staff and even the general manager does a great job at making this place one of the best bars and insuring the best atmospheres!

Good food especially for an airport. Really pleased with Sky Harbor additions of Chelsea's Kitchen and Sauce. But for food next to the gate this is a viable option. Good bacon and egg breakfast tacos as well as chicken tacos for lunch. Give it a try. Cartel coffee next door also.
Also used a living social deal.  Great place, beautiful pation, great food, and awesome day time bartender!

This place is new in the dreaded location at the south main entrance to Chandler Fashion Square.  I say "dreaded" because every restaurant here has gone out of business for some reason even though the location is ideal for a restaurant.  I think Sir Veza's might be number 4 or 5 since 2001?  I'm not sure why the others failed.  But I digress!!!

The remodel looks great.  Very open with good TV viewing everywhere, and a nice indoor/outdoor seating arrangement.  The staff was Fantastic!  They truly acted like they wanted to be there.  Our server "Fire" was on fire with his service and attitude.  Really nice guy that cared about the place and the customers.

I ordered the 2 taco combo.  They were fantastic and nicely done.  They have an interesting approach to "glueing" two corn tortillas together with cheese to make a bigger taco.   Loved the chips and sides too (charro beans and rice).  Also you could get a "protein style" taco wrapped in lettuce for you low carb types.  I wish they put cheese in those though. (they didn't with my S.O.'s lettuce-wrap taco)

Fire mentioned that they also cater to gluten free people so that's great and unusual for a Mexican joint.

The margaritas were great too, btw!

The only down sides:  

1.  I'd like to see a way to order tacos a la carte though so I could get more taco and no sides.  
2.  The prices are high for the amount of food you get.  $12 for two tacos and beans and rice, and $15 for three tacos and beans and rice.  Ouch!   This could seriously stop many folks from coming back even though they love the food, IMO.

Suggestions:
1.  Add taco take-out at the food-court window.  You can only get hotdogs or something like that now.

My new fave Mexican joint & I don't say this without several different dishes under my belt (pun intended). It figures this place is owned by the same family as the iconic El Charro in Tucson. Every dish from the tacos to the apple chimi is flavor filled & presented in awe inspiring splendor. My gal & I can recommend the SirNoran dog, the Diablo shrimp tacos, the fajitas (not your average)   Save room for dessert as the apple chimichanga is amazing & unique. The drink menu is just as creative & tasty as the food. The outdoor patio is great place to enjoy all this great fare. Ole

Surprisingly the night life at sir vezas on a Friday night was pretty cool for being connected to the mall you'd think they couldn't play the music they had bumping by a decent dj my last minute decision to have drinks with friends turned out to be a great way to end my day... open til midnight and music was so good. Drinks on the happy hour menu were eh.. which makes it 4 outta 5 stars for me. But the SirCerveza-Rita a margarita with coronita was just like the menu said, Bomb

Here today and was treated so rude by a 40 something male bartender. 

What an idiot. Why are people mean?  There was not reason to be rude you could tell that he was often rude to people as other employee had their heads down. He was some type of manager probably sad about how his life turned out so he treats people rude because there is nowhere else to go in the airport. 

If you can avoid it do not go here

This location must be under new management. The menu is a little different. We got our tacos with no meat in them and one had French fries or something in them as of the kitchen was a mess. We finally got the food runner to acknowledge us and take it back. She brought back our tacos with meat slopped in it and the tortillas were cold and getting hard. This place was amazing prior to this possible new management or the Sunday kitchen staff sucks which all the staff should be on the same standard. I will try this place one more time until I tell it to fuck off.

You hear that siren?!  We got a quality weiner alert in the desert!  YesSir Veza's thank you for offering a Sonoran dog that I would actually recommend to out of towners.  And it's also a good place to watch all the televised games on college Fball Saturday or NFL Sundays!

What grabbed my attention always walking past the food court was their Sirnoran Hot Dog had a 100% angus all beef hot dog.  I shoved it down my pie hole and enjoyed every bite!  Oh of course there's the onion rings....beer battered but batter fell apart on a few so perhaps I would pass next time but they were A-OK.  

Yes I know there are other places around town that serve the Sonoran Dog BUT well let's just say they all looked down at the floor when I ask about what kind of weiners they use!  Yea uh huh sure that's right go ahead and shove that craptastic junkified Oscar Mayer ding dong up your hoo hah where the sun don't shine!  

There was a time when "Back in the Days when I was young I'm not a kid anymore but some days I wish I was a kid again" I could care less about what's in my hot diggity dog and would only focus on taste and flava only.  Welp the name Sirnoran Dog is well deserved cause I crushed it like a Sir, like a gentleman, like a boss yessirey indeedy!  I'll be back for HH specials!

Monday around 6, seated on the patio quickly. Got our order taken quickly and the food came out within a reasonable amount of time. We got fish tacos, nachos, cheeseburger, kids chicken and rice and a chicken bowl. Everything was good and the nachos were huge. Half price margaritas and I was also able to get 5%cash back using the yelp app. We weren't crazy about their style of rice, I think it was parboiled but it was fresh and hot.

Fish tacos were good. Better than I thought they would be too. I was really hungry and thought 2 wouldn't fill me up but I was full after the first one. Good service with friendly employees. Could've been cleaner, but overall ok. Floors n ended to be swept. It was want a busy time at all so people in and out shouldn't have mattered. I've been sitting here an hour and no one attempt s to clean the floor. I also had to clean my own table off before I sat down. There was a girl walking around with a towel but she wasn't cleaning the tables!
Tasty and fast. What more do you need between flights? Decent, although not expansive, seating.

So crowded, especially since people can only drink in the small space provided. The Phoenix airport (or the alcohol authorities) need to move into the 21st century and provide an area in the terminal for drinking, like Denver. Or just open up the whole terminal to drinking like Vegas. Anyone stuck in Phoenix needs a drink. 

The queso was pretty awful. Don't get it. The taco salad was pretty good, though. But the fact that I had to eat it standing up while crammed onto a little corner of a table was kind of ridiculous. While some weirdo lectured this poor college student about how she won't be so idealistic when she grows up. Sigh.

Eh...3...3.5.  My husband had been here a couple of times for happy hour with coworkers and mentioned that I should give it a try.  I liked it more than I thought I would, but a couple of things kept it from being more stars.  We were there on 6/27 for happy hour.

Our server, Cristianna, was nice and generally efficient at circling back around to check on us.  We each ordered a $3 HH margarita and got those pretty quickly.  I didn't have high expectations for a 3-dollar margarita, and it was just that...a cheap margarita.  I ordered another one I think for only 2 reasons:  it was hot out and they were 3 bucks, but I really didn't enjoy them and they gave me heartburn.  Meh.  

I ordered the 1 and only combo with the jalopy taco and that was a tasty dish.  It comes with a very small cheese enchilada, a delicious tamale, and you can choose a taco.  The jalopy taco is loaded down with ground beef, fried potatoes, lettuce, cheese, olives, etc. and I really enjoyed that as well.  Overall I think it's a little overpriced at $15.95.  It came with a side of clumpy rice and flavorless charro beans.  I ended up doctoring up the leftovers for breakfast the next day.  The tamale was really the best part of that dish.  

Mr. M had the sirnoran dog with onion strings and it was a really good hot dog but the bun was way too big.  That entree was $9.95.  Now that I pay attention to some of the other pictures, we'll definitely have to come back and try those batter-dipped fries.  The onion strings were really greasy and all clumped together.  Not all that appealing.

All in before tax and tip it was $43.13.  I don't regret it, but I do think it was a bit much.  

Another thing that dropped a star was the ladies' room was pretty nasty, and it was 5:30 in the afternoon.  I can't imagine how it is at 9:00 at night.  Yikes!  I would go back, but it's not high on my list.
As airport for goes really great. Small, wish they had a better seating capacity but the food was spot on and prepared fast.

Go to barrio queen instead. It's in the D gates. I love spicy food. When I get Mexican food I expect a reasonable amount of hot sauce. When I realized that my husband and I had only gotten 1 TINY container of hot sauce between our salad and burrito bowl I was concerned. I went back to ask for another and was informed even though I had ordered my salad without sour cream or cheese I had been given my allotted hot sauce and would have to go through the line again and pay for another tiny container of hot sauce.  Come on now, please. Service was deplorable. Stop at barrio queen in D gates and actually get good service and enjoy your food!

BEST tacos. Grilled chicken is the way to go. We always go here for taco Tuesday. Tacos are half off and the service is great and the food always comes out so fast. I literally won't go to any other tacos spot. I just wish it wasn't at the chandler mall but that's the only down fall. Try this place out

Very very little food given in the vegetable bowl. The container provided was less than half way full. I never write bad reviews but I think $10 for a snack is a bit much. Two stars given because service was quick and food was flavorful.
I stopped by for Tuesday tacos and was delighted. My server was friendly and helpful with the drink menu .  The salsa was wonderful.  Interesting selection of,tacos which made for some fun!

2.0 Stars.

I understand price gouging at airports.
But $9.99 for a 6-8 inch burrito?
It was tasty, but it was no meal...merely a snack.

I felt robbed. I had a 1 1/2 hour lay over.
I should have walked around a little and asked if
there was a McDonald's in the airport.

SURE ENOUGH...THERE IS !!!

Don't spend your money here if you are really hungry.

Horrrible service. This IS an airport location so timelines is key. I just stood for ten minutes while the bartender was trying to teach Spanish to customers at bar. I was at an open seat and I didn't even get an acknowledgement that I was alive. Never ever will I go there again and I am here multiple times a week

If you are in the Phoenix airport there are some good food options, my favorite are the sit down places, but if I don't have a lot of time, I will come here. I get the bowl, they put this sauce on it that is really good! It's a "crema" :). I've not tried their tacos or other dishes, but it's pretty decent for airport food. I would caution against ordering the chicken, it's not the best chicken, I would try the pork, beef, etc. 

I haven't tried the fish either, but they do have fish tacos.

Happy Airport Eating!

Their website advertised happy hour everyday from 3pm-7pm. However, we were told that does not include sunday. Sunday does have a happy hour that starts at 4pm.

We came here at 3 specifically for happy hour & were disappointed.

However, even though the price was too high ($11 for a cheese crisp), the service & product were good.

Me and my husband came here for lunch on a Saturday. It wasn't moderately busy. The servers kept walking past us without noticing us. It took a little bit for the server to come over to order our drinks. The alcohol was expensive. $10 for a margarita. We both got waters. Husband ordered the Sorrano Dog and it was very good. I ordered the Carn√© Asada burrito for $12.95. It only came with lettuce and a small amount of pico de gallo. Additional add ons were extra for the burrito. Burrito contained dry steak, black beans, cheese, and rice mixed with bean mixture. The filling was very dry and not very good to me. I had to eat some of my husband's fries. We also had the complimentary chips and salsa. The chips were all broken up into small pieces, like the bottom of the bag chips. The salsa was good. I had to pour it over my burrito to make it taste better.

I love Sir Veza's! The staff are very friendly and attentive. When you order food, it always comes out quickly. The happy hour menu is awesome! The drink and food specials during happy hour are reasonably priced and happen everyday from 3-7. Margaritas are strong and flavorful. Tacos are huge and can easily be split among two people. A+++!

Updating my review. I've been back here a number of times. The taco salad is still the best. Most of the time it is amazing. They have their off days sometimes but they always try to make it right if needed. 

Guac, tacos, taco salad, can't go wrong!!

We went here for convenience. Good for airport food. Tacos, burritos or bowls. Comes with a variety of ingredients and choice of protein. You pay up front at the register, then they prepare your food in a to-go box to eat in their small restaurant seating area or take with you to your gate. 

We got the beef bowl. Came with a good amount of rice, beans, meat, cheese, sour cream, salsa and even guacamole without extra charge. The portion size was good compared to the price of other restaurants at the airport. 

For what it was, airport food, it was decently priced, fast and tasted pretty good. Nothing to rant and rave about, but we were satisfied.
Hubby and I came here for the first time today before going Christmas shopping and the food is amazing. The staff is nice and attentive. Love this place and will definitely be back to try happy hour.

One of the staff members at the airport location has a really horrible attitude and approach with customers. We laughed at the ridiculousness of it and choose not to engage and opted for another line. She called me a f*cking stupid b*tch and then told me to move over so she could take another order when I could not move as I was waiting for the person in front of me to move and she was just trying to subvert power over me after I choose not engage. She was still angry and told a manager, that came over for her employees defense (and not an advocate for the business, customer, or even general ETHICAL values), minimized the whole thing and just asked us to move. Needless to say, we left and did not get to try the food for fear of retaliation. The lack of customer service and professionalism is definitely a huge problem. The serious anger/mental health issues of the employee should be a concern to everyone.
