We couldn't even get in the door and give them our money before their collection of horrible employees showed us we probably shouldn't. At the very least I appreciate that. When people show you who they are, believe them.

Delicious fish tacos, quickly prepared and served. Expensive, but that's pretty typical of airport food. Crowded seating area, but I still found a cozy place to eat. If I ever have another layover here I'd be happy to fine here again.

I've been here 3x thus far and each time has been a great experience. The food is always incredible, their Long Islands are perfection and the staff is always willing to assist you w/ anything. If you're leery of trying something really different, order a chicken quasadilla... BOMB.COM

The food was mediocre. The carne asada was too thick and maybe should be changed to steak on the menu. The steak was tough and without flavor. The salsa was blah and tasted like tomato sauce. The Las Vegas roll was good but needed a spice element because by itself it was bland as well.

Cool happy hour vibe. Gets really busy so come early or have patience with good friends or family.
Taco tour is a can't miss. Get the carne asada or pollo.
Wash it down with a decent selection of cervezas on tap.

My salad was very tasty. My husbands tacos were good but had very few veggies on it, mostly meat, which isn't what we prefer in a taco. Service was so-so. 
The biggest complaint was the music was so loud we couldn't hear each other at all. And one of the waitress smelled heavily of alcohol. I MIGHT come back but my husband definitely would not.

Girlsfriends and I took a weekend trip to Phoenix, and came across this awesome place! The food was fresh and amazing. The customer service was above and beyond. Our waitress Layne, was one of the most honest and down to earth servers I've ever had. I would definitely recommend giving it a try.

Quick and friendly service on a very busy morning at the Phoenix airport! There are a lot of tasty options. I had the black bean breakfast bowl. It was hard to choose because I wanted a few different items. The bowl was pretty great-especially for fast airport food. I also loved the coffee! 

There isn't a lot of seating so you may have to stand or take it to go if it's a busy airport day!

Worst, slowest service ever. I had limited time to get food before a 2.5 hour flight home, and I ordered a simple quesadilla, waited 15 mins and ended up refunding it to catch my flight. Angry, hungry, annoyed. 6 people working, only 3 cooking with the other 3 standing around...get it together, people, speed matters at airports.

In the spirt of taco Tuesday , I came here and it was a great discussion ! Half of tacos , they were great , ceviche wasn't awesome :( 
Oh well , it's still a cool place

We bought a Living Social for this place and were excited to try it out. The atmosphere is funky and fun. 

We ordered the T-bucket Sampler (fries, onion rings, carnitas quesadilla, mini chimis, chicken fingers)  and the 2 tacos (carnitas and centerfold). The food was delicious and their prickly pear bbq sauce is delish! The bucket was HUGE and had plenty of food for the two of us. We had enough leftovers just from the bucket for another complete meal.

The waiter was extremely friendly and attentive. Service was quick. Our waiter even offered us a to-go drink for the road which I LOVE!  We will be back!

First off I love this place the food is amazing but the only reason we keeps coming back is because of Marcus! He gives the best service always gives us the best recommendation on food! If you ever stop into this place he's your sever to go too!
Chips n salsa, good drank, good thangs!!!! Staff is super friendly and the environment is on point.

Cool casual place.  Great music. Decor is very well done. Prompt with the chips and salsa which were delicious. Excellent beer selection. We had the pork carnitas tacos and the grilled chicken tacos. Both were excellent.

just ok food and terrible service....you smile and say hello and thank you and the tattooed ghetto girls here smirk at you......ALL OF THEM.....fourth time here....they are at least consistent at not training their staff...... trying something else next time...
Tacos are good  atmosphere not so great  loud alternative rock music screaming too loud, should find something to play that all ages might enjoy! So loud, had a hard time talking with my date!

Surprisingly good. Got the taco salad. Was at first disappointed because I only saw lettuce, but once I dug in, got to the crunchy taco shell, nicely grilled chicken pieces (lots of it) and delicious beans and other ingredients. Not a lot of seats though so it was a bit difficult to get comfortable but the food was delicious.
I stopped here for a quick lunch before a flight and was pleasantly surprised. The quality beats Chipotle. The bowl was fantastic, really hit the spot.

Actually good, but really quite expensive. Would love a more Chipotle style menu where you pick a base and select what you want. I came here while on Whole30 and basically got a slab of meat with salsa for $13. Not the best deal and would have loved some lettuce or vegetables or something like that. Other than that, a fair place for some decent food at the airport. 

The main detraction from this place is the seating. It's really awkward and hard to walk around so don't sit here if you have a lot of luggage - you'll probably have to stand.

Here for a flight to SLC....
courteous and quick staff ....yummy breakfast bacon-egg- potato burrito and perfect mimosa to let me nap a bit on the flight!
Personally I wouldn't recommend out the food was not what I was expecting. Service was alright bit the best.

This is based on my visit to the walk up counter in the mall to the sit down restaurant.  I got a Sonora dog and it was great.  I also liked that I was give chips and salsa just like I was in the sit down restaurant.
Maybe next time I will go inside and see what else they have to offer.

Really good! Was surprised, with all the big names in the airport like zinc, chelsea's, chevraunt, I wanted something quick. It was quick but wow it was really good! Carnitas & chicken tacos with corn tortillas had great flavor. Even the beans & rice (beans on top of rice) were seasoned perfectly. Kiltlifter on tap I like this place. If I get a chance to come again they may make it to 5 star.

Wow.  Airport food that is delicious. Chicken tacos are my favorite as the hot salsa they provide is made with quality ingredients.  

Definitely will visit the Chandler location soon.
Delicious food; fast, friendly service. Will definitely be back!

We decided to try our Sir Veza's while taking a break from Christmas shopping. We heard about it about 2 months ago when we were in Tucson on a weekend get away. While there we ate at place called El Charro and the owner told us he was opening a new restaurant near us.

The restaurant was auto garage themed but I think the restaurant  is suffering from an identity crisis because the building mentioned nothing about being a taco garage, only yelp totally us that.

Service was good, but they served Pepsi products (not a Pepsi fan). Second the food was so so. The chips and salsa were great, but our appetizer was a big bucket of oily fried foods. Enough so, that had we finished all of it, we probably wouldn't have felt great. The portions on items that went by our table were huge, maybe too big. All and all, I've say it was average, not horrible, not great, just average.

Thought I'd grab a bite while waiting for my flight. The good:  counter service was great. The slider buns were fresh.
The mediocre:  burger patty didn't look like or taste like beef.  It was mashed down on the flat top it was dry and devoid of any meat juice. The Monterrey jack cheese was no where to be found and the thousand island dressing couldn't help over come the overcooked, dry patty. The fries we cooked in a fryer used to cook seafood. 

The bakery next door would have been a better choice.

You can always judge a place by the quality of the salsa when it hits the table. Meh. That's the story behind this place: meh. Severely over-priced for what you get and the wait staff is clearly just counting down the minutes until their shift ends and they are freed. I'd get more customer service from a robot. Margarita was terrible, but my Corona was solid . Take your $12-13/per person and go to Barrio or Joyride if you're interested in great tacos.

Our flight from Washington to Burbank had a layover at Phoenix.  I remembered going to Sir Veza's a little over a year ago and I really like their Chorizo burrito.  It was completely crowded so it took a while to get our food.  This time my daughter and I ordered the following:

Cheese quesadilla ($9): hardly any cheese but my daughter still said she liked it. 

Combo Taco place ($12): I got the carnitas and birria taco and they were pretty good.  Lots of tender meat so it was good.  

At least I know a decent and expensive place to eat at when I'm at the Phoenix Airport.

This place is really cool. The flat enchiladas are so good. I was also happy that they had a huge selection of draft beer. We sat at the bar and loved that they use shop rags as napkins. really unique. The chips and salsa were addictive. I will be back.

No. No. No. Do not waste your time or money on this place. Terrible service for an empty establishment and even worse drinks. I ordered Patron and got bar tequila. Like I wouldn't be able to tell the difference.  Go next door to Kona grill.

This trip to Sky Harbor Airport Term 4 included a visit to Sir Veza's.

Food
Average - not bad, not memorable.

Atmosphere
Cool, rustic antique-looking stuff  surrounds the dining area.

I wouldn't walk across the concourse to eat here, but it wasn't terrible.

Good thing they have a captive flow of hungry diners waiting for flights to airports near and far

Do yourself a favor the next time you're in Sky Harbor and get the veggie tacos. I prefer the flour tortillas. 

People have to be ordering the wrong thing here! Why only a 3 star rating?? I've eaten meat for 28 years and the vegetarian tacos have got to be some of the best tacos I have ever had, meat or vegetarian. 

Personally, the small side of rice and beans isn't anything to get excited about, but the tacos are killer. I travel a lot for work and every time I stop in phoenix, I make a trip over to sir vezas near C12 no matter where I get into or fly out of. 

I have a friend in Tucson who was like "meh" when I suggested sir vezas. Once he had the tacos, he was pleasantly surprised and a convert.  You will be too.
Ask for Matthew! ON POINT!! Awesome service, food and brews. Best service I've had in years, definitely coming back.

Was connecting in PHX and tried this place out because there was nothing else there. Got a chicken bowl and was pretty disappointed. Chicken had tons of fat on it and was very bland on it. Rest of the bowl was okay but still not something I would try again.

My visit was for the Mayweather fight. The cover was absurd $30 per person. But considering the place wasn't very crowded we went for it. They sat us at a small table with no view of the very few TV's in the restaurant. We took it upon ourselves to sit in a better view area. And then were told that the table was reserved, but would only be relocated once they showed up. They never showed. As for the service, it was super slow. It seemed like we were the last table to get service and if we needed anything we waited forever for staff to come back around. We even went up to the bar to order our own drinks. What made it even worse is there was a group of fruit flies flying around a few tables that made it disgusting to eat or be around. I ordered a micheladas, worst one I have ever tasted. They use like the premixed lime juice, which tasted like margarita mix, no clamato. I reordered for a mojito and the same mix was used! Drinks are horrible!!! Order a beer to be safe. I would not go back nor recommend this place.

Great bar and restaurant! 

Loved this place in Tucson and it is a good set up for Chandler fashion.

I recommend the happy hour specials and watching UofA here!

Certainly in the top ten for airport food.  The food portions are generous, and while you're overpaying because it's an airport, it's not too ridiculous.  Service has always been fast and friendly for both food and drinks.  They have a pretty good selection of craft beers too.
Fish tacos were pretty tasty but came with no sauce.  Asked for green salsa and got red.  Also, it was $24 for 4 tacos
Great food, we had the tacos. They were delicious and good sized. Not little dinky street tacos. The music is just very loud so it's hard to hold a conversation.

Pretty decent for airport food.  Quick and not bad.  Ordered combination tacos (you can mix and match) before a flight, they packed it really well - each taco was individually wrapped in a foam box and then a bag.  No messes here.

I ordered one chicken taco and one carnitas taco both in flour.  Chicken was tasty, good flavors, not dry.  The carnitas taco was greasy and not as flavorful - would not recommend.  They charged me an extra 50 cents for the combo.  Guacamole is an extra 75 cents.  Salsa verde comes with your order, but it's pre packaged and not fresh.  

I didn't have time (and the real reason I had a morning flight) - or else it looked like a great place to drink prior to take off!

Great ambience and service.  Mediocre mexican food.  Not terrible, just not memorable.  If you want to drink and have fun with friends this is a good bet. If you are looking for good food, try somewhere else.

Just say no. This place looked like a fun place to eat. Boy was I wrong. After checking out the menu we asked the server what she recommended since none of us had eaten there before. She recommended the enchiladas and nachos. My husband and dad ordered the enchiladas and I ordered the nachos. The enchiladas came in a scalding hot iron pan and appeared to be a soup since the small
Enchiladas were drowning in a sea of red sauce. You seriously couldn't even see them. No one mentioned the skillet they came in was very hot when the food was delivered and my father burned his fingers to the blistering point by touching it to move his platter around. My nachos were ordered with the carnitas which was cold and unappetizing. And I had a bout of food poisoning the next morning. 

As a newcomer to the Chandler area I was looking forward to a fun and delicious meal at Sir Vezas. Let me just say, this was my first and last visit there.

Wanted to pick up a quick bite before my flight and well...it definitely wasn't quick or worth it. I ordered a vegetarian bowl which was basically just beans rice, guacamole, sour cream and salsa. Came out to about $8.50. It was easy to place my order but I had to wait 13 minutes to receive it. The space is very small and crowded and there isn't really any place to stand and wait for your to go order. Talking to another customer, she seemed very frustrated at the wait time as well. I didn't notice until I got onto the plane that my rice was over cooked and hard which was disappointing but I was starving.

I was not a fan of my experience and the food was mediocre but it was convenient. 

They do have a bar with tv's which a lot of people seemed to be utilizing because the football game was on. The staff was also friendly.
Meh...Hungry at the Phoenix airport and they were playing the NBA finals...Why does "meh" airport food have to be sooo pricey?
Staff unpleasant and dismissive.  Food awful.  I travel through Phoenix often, will never again pay for the overpriced "food" again.
My BF and I come here a lot as they have vegan food and are happy to accommodate my picky needs. Chuck and Fire behind the bar are always friendly and pour a tasty drink!

The atmosphere and d√©cor are really nice and make for a fun place to eat.

I got the tacos; I never order tacos from anywhere. Felt like they were missing something, like a little spice, but were overall good. Also the brownie with ice cream was bomb!

Our server was very nice and quick to serve out table of 5, + 2 kids. Even better is the fact that they have groupons, which we used.

I will most likely be back and plan to try something different.

Located near C11, you can eat at Sir Veza's at the few seats they have available or take it to go. They have breakfast burritos, meaty burritos and a vegetarian veggie burrito that can be made vegan if you ask them to leave the cheese off. You can also have rice bowls, chips, guac, queso, etc. 

I have had the vegan veggie burrito twice now and it was consistently delicious. It has a lot of black beans so if you are sensitive to the effects of beans, just ask them to leave it off. Also in that burrito is rice, peppers, onions, corn and guac. Their salsas are prepackaged and both red and green are so delicious. They are considerably quick for food made to order so you can grab food in between flights.

The guacamole was delicious but I was not impressed with the chips. They did not have any seasoning or salt on them so they lacked flavor. I would definitely order the burrito again or a burrito bowl.
Want to know how to gross a vegetarian out? Stick a big chunk of chicken in their vegan burrito bowl. Never again!
Chuck the bartender is amazing! Love his bartender ears and handmade sangria ;) and D the waitress is on point, not even our server and made sure we had anything we needed the entire time! 5 stars

We decided to try this place since Kona was packed. There happy hour food was pretty much all fried food nothing healthy. Nor was any of it to write home about . the so called spicy was sweet. There was 6 of us we all ordered dinner and not one of us was impressed what so ever.then or dirty plates sat in front of us for over a half a hour tell I see our girl and I asked her to please take them away.  So not impressed with this place. Don't think we will be back:((( we will stick with Kona grill

I came in for the first time a few days ago and had an amazing experience! I have pretty high standards for mexican food but the nitro nachos topped all my expectations. Our server, Denise was such a delight and made us some awesome table side guac! I will definitely be back!!
Single. Use. Plastics. Unless you're at a keg party, this is not a good way to serve beer. The food is adequate.

Flight delayed and was super hungry, so I decided to eat here. Airport restaurant, didnt expect much. Cashier recommended carnitas tacos and I am so glad I got it. Is it overpriced at 12 dollars? Definitely. Was it delicious though? Yep! Being from California, I have had my fair share of Mexican food, and I would say the tacos I got definitely held it's own in terms of quality (but perhaps divide cost by 2)

Dee was an amazing hostess. Joe was a really good guy totally gave me the menu, let me know exactly what it is that they were serving. They were super cool especially letting me know that they're happy hour is from 3 PM to 7 PM, and from 9 PM to closing time. Thank you guys very much for being super cool I'm from totally hooking me up. I really appreciate businesses that go the extra mile. I love the bar atmosphere, and I totally love the food. Once again thank you guys.

the tortilla was undercooked, the potatoes were overcooked, the cheese was almost non-existent. the eggs tasted like they were from powder. and the whole thing cost about $4 more than such a small burrito should, even at the airport.

The vegetarian tamales here were excellent. I am a picky tamale critic, having grown up in CA, but this spot fit the bill. The breakfast bowl was pretty tasty, though I guess I was expecting it to be over rice. The tortilla chips were an odd find, but hey, I guess a starch is a starch...sort of. I would've preferred eggs and sour cream etc over rice, but it was still good. Had my flight been delayed any longer I would've gone back for more items from the lunch menu. Service here was fast, even during busy rushes. I'll definitely come back here on my next layover on Southwest. Thanks guys!
Pricey but good. The sonoran hot dog was delicious. Taco salad also a good choice.

It's like a knock off chipotle but the food is disgusting. I got the chicken bowl. The rice was hard and the beans were cold . The chicken was flavorless . The beer was cold even tho it was served in a red solo cup. The staff was really nice tho which is why they got a star. Worst airport food I've ever had, and i travel a lot!
Debra Is the best. Great food and very kind, efficient service on a busy Thanksgiving weekend.

I had the chicken burrito. It was really dry and missing the Queso that it's advertised with. It's the only time I've eaten here, so maybe something else will be better. Just not that. The service was quick and price was moderate for an airport.
I dont expect much from airport food but REALLY?   Slider was terrible, 14 french fries  to go along with this Dry meal!    Nachos were bland at best.   Rather have hit up McDonald's!!!

Had a mimosa & Bloody Mary along with a breakfast burrito.  Service from the bar was great.  Burrito was ok, not bad.  Mimosa was good, Bloody Mary was not bad.  I didn't like the salt/spice rim that they used. Overall I'd come here again and sit at the bar

Not the best food in the world but when your flight has been delayed and you're just about starving it does the job. Decent prices and pretty kick ass service. Geo and the team made my crappy day so much better.
When I get charged 50 cents for a side of barbecue sauce...I'm not coming back any time soon.

Hands down one of the best laid back bars to come in and enjoy your time with friends , the food was amazing (Diablo, pork) and the gluten free chips and salsa were just as amazing as the two margaritas , Our server Joe despite the 5 or 6 tables it looked like he had insured our drinks were filled and table was cleared of any dirty dishes along with the others . Couldn't help but leave $20 def the highest tip I've ever left for just my friend and myself. The manager and other employees were just as awesome coming by and checking on everyone ! Please stay !!

AWFUL AWFUL AWFUL
Been here a few times over the last couple of years.... this by far was the worst and the last time.  No greeter at the door incorporated with slow and lethargic employees who clearly have no sense of urgency whatsoever makes a very bad impression.  Had to ask for items twice before getting them.  Basics like asking if sweetener was needed when serving ice tea, completely non existent. All of this while the restaurant is slow is unacceptable to say the least. Patio furniture ripped and falling apart at the seams clearly says that the owners/operators don't care about this place.  Looks like this restaurant space will be available soon.  Good luck Sir.  If you want to stay in business at this location, you'll need it.

I stopped in for a bite to eat since I had plenty of time before my flight. I ordered shredded beef tacos, queso and chips, and rice. The rice I could have passed on, it was flavorless and dry but as far as the rest of my meal it was fantastic. The tacos had good spice and were so juicy. Sir Veza's was little too crowded though, I had no place so sit and wait for my food. A little frustrating but I guess a good crowd means good food.

Not a great experience. Friendly cashier but the food comes out very slowly (20 minutes for a takeout order).

The carnitas bowl was not great (granted that I got it without onions and peppers and sour cream). The rice was undercooked (hard), the carnitas were neither crispy nor stewed well and too salty, and the salsa was packaged. It was at least half beans.

At least it was filling.

Great airport spot. They serve you drinks in red Solo cups LOL. Wish it wasn't so packed, but I guess that's what happens when you have the best food and drank in the terminal #hype
PS I'm the duchess

Not worth it for the price. I ordered guacamole and chips for $8.25, and it was 1/4 cup of guacamole with about 40+ chips that went to the trash can. It wasn't a great appetizer, either. I was craving guacamole so I risked paying almost $10, and it was a mistake. Maybe their other items are worth the cost for the quality and quantity.

Stopped by here for a beer while I waited for my flight. The staff is super friendly and are always there when you need something. As far as the food, its your typical taco shop in arizona, nothing amazing, but good (been to other locations). The thing that drops my review down is the unprofessionalism of the manager. I don't car what is happening you dont discipline your employees in front of customers. Yelling load enough for the whole place to hear for them to "find something to do", and saying "he knows he is mean so sorry". Dude you need to take a leadership or managment course. Other than that its a decent place to go.

This is a very poor representation of what an Arizona burrito should taste like. Places like this are the reason the people of California think their burritos are better. When in fact they are absolutely not better than a real Arizona burrito. I would rather have Taco Bell than eat a burrito here. But they have free refills on soft drinks. So I guess that's a plus.

This place is great. Beer is served only in red Solo cups just like a proper dive bar. Build your own burritos, fish tacos. All good. Hey you're in an airport, set expectations accordingly! Love this place

Omg please get the Diablo shrimp tacos. They are life changing. Hahaha. 

Honestly though the food is awesome, and the waitstaff are all knowledgable, with a great list of recommendations from the menu. The tacos are AMAZING. I was hungry so I ordered three and should've only gotten two. They are amazing flavors and expertly made. :)

Definitely check them out!

I came to eat here when visiting my brother in Arizona. He swore this place had the best micheladas in Arizona so I for sure needed to try. It was a Friday afternoon around 4pm-5pm so it wasn't too packed yet. It was happy hour so they had 1/2 off appetizers and some discounted drinks which was good. We ordered a round of micheladas and let me tell you, my brother wasn't lying. They were good! When it came to the food, I ordered a appetizer. It was the Jalapeno Poppers (they had a different name and cant remember what it is). They were ok. Very crunchy which im not use to with jalapeno poppers and the cream cheese inside was very runny. I wouldn't get them again. For my meal I ordered the shrimp tacos (grilled shrimp not the Diablo shrimp) and it came with rice and beans. The rice and beans were not good. I'm Mexican so I guess you can say I have a high standard of what they should taste like and this wasn't it. Very generic almost tasted like they were canned. The rice was also not well cooked, kinda dry and crunchy. The shrimp tacos were good. The seasoning was good and the salsa it had was also very good. I would get them again but minus the rice and beans. All in all a great place for drinks but if you want Mexican food, definitely not the place for it.

I actually think the food is four stars based on the airport scale of jeebusi'vebeenpoisonedtellmyfamilyilovethem to prettygoodactuallyididntjustgoovermycaloriesfortheweekinoneday.   Just clean your tables and give us more seats. It's crowded like a frat party on a Friday night. Forfuxsake.
Awesome beer selection! Tons of rotating seasonals. The whole staff was great, especially our server, Denise. Ideal atmosphere to watch the fights.

for a Hispanic themed restaurant it didn't really taste Hispanic. The chicken burrito was ok, reason being is the beans were too dry and the chicken was flavorless yet the rice was surprisingly good. The pre packages salsa was not spicy whatsoever and was ok.

The two stars is for ambiance and location only.  Awesome location with outdoor patio area draws you in.  BUT.. service is non-existent. Servers always try to look busy doing something else.  After 15 minutes waiting for water,  went to the bar to get it myself.  Food sounded good on the menu and looks appealing inn other tables but totally flavorless and bland (No Bueno for Mexican food).  What a shame, cool name, hip location and cool setup. Now you just need to get the employees to give a shit about taking advantage of what they have.
So loud and and uncomfortable. Extremely pricey and they give very little food. Def one of my worse airports breakfasts. Don't come here

What do you say? Over priced airport food. The chicken burrito was dry. It only came with chicken rice and beans. No sauces. 

We also ordered the 3 cheese quesadilla and that was pretty good but still it was $8. Over priced airport food.

This place is amazing for an airport eating spot. Cool vibe, friendly employees, but mostly good and reasonably-priced food. Don't they know they have us where they want us and are supposed to rip us off with high prices for marginal food? I guess these guys didn't get the memo and I'm glad. I always get the chicken bowl, but many things look really good. A big selection of craft beers on tap and flat screens seal the deal. Now I look forward to landing in Phoenix and long layovers don't even scare me anymore. Like most places in any airport the elbow room is a little close and cozy, but that just goes with the territory. Fly in when you get a chance!
Great chicken bacon quesadillas.  Tortillas are insanely good.   Staff is friendly and good atmosphere for a airport

I ordered the breakfast bowl with Applewood bacon and queso. I asked for no salsa, which they accommodated me on that. However, their chilaquilas (an ingredient in my bowl) is really enchilada sauce. In what world are those two the same thing? Chilaquilas is eggs, nacho chip strips, ranchero sauce and cheese. Since they soaked all of the chips in this enchilada sauce, the whole thin tasted horrible. The bacon was in whole slices rather than broken up - doesn't make sense for eating a bowl. They used green olives which I've NEVER had on Mexican food. I hate green olives and would have asked which kind they were had I thought they might something other than the traditional black olives. My husband did not like his breakfast tacos either. The only reason they are getting two stars is we've had good quesadillas here before.

I've been here several times and have always thought the service was mediocre to nonexistent. The icing on top was recently when I came here for dinner. We were seated. My boyfriend had time to use the bathroom and then return. I had time to book a reservation for an event. After doing all this, I realized about 10+ minutes elapsed and no one had come to say hi. So I started looking around and try to give off that body language that we were ready to order. Still, no one came. So, my boyfriend and I left. Once we stood up, someone finally realized we were leaving and offered to get someone immediately but by this time, we had already decided to go. 

As for the food, it's mediocre. They do have sizable margaritas. 

Layout of restaurant is kind of strange but there is a lot of open space that leads to patio, which is nice for a cooler spring/fall/winter day. 

Overall, horrible service and unimpressive.
Amazing food and great service! Probably the best shrimp taco my travel partner has ever had, and I ordered the vegetarian taco which was great!! Super fast, would definitely eat here again.

Our second time and this food and unique margaritas are really awesome... The tacos are also very good and several unique taco varieties... The service has been great very informative servers that seemed passionate about the menu.... I'm Surprised this place is not packed more often... It's better food than Kona Grill next door.  Killer salsa

*** So sad. They changed the menu and now the Nivana taco is made with Brussel sprouts and fajita mix which I can not eat .  I can't even express how sad this makes me 


I didn't think it was possible but they got even better with updates menu I'm loving the Nirvana vegetarian tacos. Wonderful!  I've had them two days in a row   David provided awesome service!  He's our regular guy . 

Excellent food and service !  All seasonings are gluten free.  Burro bowl not just filled with rice like some places. I had the shredded chicken.  I tasted shredded beef and really good not fatty.

They have $8 lunch and 1/2 off taco Tuesday 

Dog friendly patio

Large outside space. I bet it's really busy at night as they have happy hour and really fun atmosphere 

I'll be back for sure
I loved it here!! The decor was fun, the beers were cold, the food was great, and the service was exceptional.  Make sure you try the prickly pear wings!

Incredibly rude staff, heard them talking behind the counter about other customers; ordered a burrito bowl and was given an actual burrito, staff looked at me like I was crazy when I brought it back and said my order was wrong, then proceeded to talk to each other about it when I was standing right there. Too bad the customer service is awful because the food is actually not too bad.

can airport food be both expensive AND crappy? sir veza's strives to answer that question, and answer it they do. while at first glance the menu appears promising, assuming you can get past the idea that you're paying 5 dollars for a single beef taco, the delivery unfortunately falls short. 

the chips were stale, the tomatoes had that mealy texture of refrigeration, and the chicken was clearly frozen shortly prior to my consumption of it.  while a good guacamole can cover a multitude of sins, this guac did not cover for anyone. it was tasteless.

in short, this is a passable meal for a disappointing (but not surprising) price. i was not expecting greatness, but i was hoping for it. i'll keep hoping somewhere else, i suppose.

Very, very good. As soon as I saw this popping up in the mall I was interested. I just visited for the first time and was a worthwhile experience. They have a variety of nice beers available, and the happy hour(s) are generous. I do particularly like the open air bar setup they've got going on, especially since they've  kept it very clean. Fast and friendly service. Definitely get the SirVeza fries. They are incredible.

I was pretty excited to try this place. We were told to seat ourselves and someone would come by.... 20 minutes later, I got a walking by waitress and asked her if she could get someone to bring us menus. She was super apologetic. The food was less than decent. I had chicken tacos which was good and a carne asada taco which was NOT, bland no flavor. Service was slow, place was not too busy. Not impressed. Not worth my money, even with the discount I got from Living Social.

Stopped here for a quick bite prior to my flight. Made my bowl vegan which basically came down to 5 ingredients and boy did they skimp. For the price, and I get it.... The airport is always overpriced, but then you add in the reduction of food choices that comes with the meal and it was like I got half the serving for a full price. Needless to say it was not worth the price at all. The speed however was super quick and seeing the amount of people they were serving food to at once that was pretty impressive. 

Well, you live and you learn next time I just have to pack my lunch when flying, just sucks when you're delayed. Maybe they can figure out some kind of balance to make the cost with it.

We tried this place out for Happy Hour and we were not impressed.  Service was spotty, house margs were weak, we had to ask for chips and salsa and when we finished the small amount brought to us, we were never asked if we wanted more.  I tried the tamale pie corn fritters.  They were uncooked in the middle and lacked flavor.  We also got the papas locas which are cheese fries.  The description says cheddar, but it was actually a cheese sauce and the fries were drenched in it.  The fries were mushy, and not just because of the enormous amount cheese sauce.  The BF got the chicken sliders which he said were "ok".  Nothing about this place makes me look forward to going back...so we probably won't.

I wish there was a 0 star option. Went in last night for a few drinks. We were seated right away but no one came to take our order, or even notice that we were sitting there for about 25 minutes. All the waiters just kept walking by. It wasn't even busy. So we walked out and no one seemed to care. I will never step foot in that place again.

Great atmosphere and fun, service wasn't great and the food was so, so. Not sure if it was an off night, but we had water spilled on us, nasty dirty silverware, and a gentleman threw up in the floor right by our table...hoping for a better second experience someday because it has potential to be super fun.
Always stop by here for my Bloody Mary's before heading out to wherever I have to go. Great service and great food!

So so bad. Do not waste your time or money. Chips and queso... seems simple right? Nope. Chips were soft and moist, and the queso was some crap out of a jar that was just lightly melted over a few chips. Also ordered some drinks from the bar.  Margarita came without salt asked of i could get salt and the bartender responds with, did you ask for salt? Omg, really are you serious? The answer is yes, but even if i didn't why would you even ask me that? Then my beer had 2 inches of foam in leaving my 16 oz beer with about 11oz drinkable.  I don't normally rant on yelp, but I truly don't want anyone else to make the same mistake that we did this evening.  Make the walk to gate A11 and eat at taco Blanco's 4 stars Mexican at terminal 4.

One doesn't expect too much from an airport eatery, but Sir Veza's Taco Garage is pretty darn good.  If you don't mind your tamales a little greasy, then you should give the corn and green chiles tamales a try.  Need something even simpler than that?  I enjoyed the beans and rice.  They're seasoned just right.

In short: if you're hungry in Terminal 4, pick this place.

I can't speak for the food, but I can say that the margaritas they have for Happy Hour are dang good!  They're only like $3 on happy hour which is basically a steal.  We were served complimentary chips and salsa even though we weren't ordering food which was really nice.  The bartender was very attentive and had a great repoir with all the patrons.

I sat there for 10 min and nothing from the staff. All 5 behind the counter. I finally asked for a menu and what type of non alcoholic beer they had. the manager pull away from his phone and bragging to other customers about how much he works and points to the wall for the menu. Goes back to his phone and tells me no non alcoholic "anything". That was it for helping me. Another 20 min of waiting with no help I went next door to paradise bakery. Having to eat at an airport bar is bad enough without shit service and attitude.
$10 for a sad tiny bowl with extremely dry grilled chicken. Way overpriced and so not worth it. ):

Grabbed the sliders, on the way to CO and they were great!  Such a pleasant surprise!  They were well priced at $10 for two, with fries.  The burgers were substantial, for sliders, well cooked and seasoned.   The fries were shoe strings and perfectly crunchy and salty.  Will stop by again when traveling next time!

This place is alright. The car theme is pretty cool and it's tastefully decorated with a nice layout. Decent menu selection of Mexican food and a full bar. Food was better than I expected and was served quickly. We had an awesome waitress so our service was great. Prices were reasonable for the quality. Entire place was clean, including the restrooms. Will come here again if in the area. (I didn't get the "Sir Veza's"= cerveza, as in the Spanish word for beer, until after I left. hahaha)

The restaurant is difficult to get seating and very crowded. 

The fish tacos were one of the best I've tasted. It's hard to find good tasting food in airports. The prices are fair given that everything in the airport is pricier. 

We got the chicken bacon quesadilla, the chicken bowl, and the hot dog.  The hot dog was exceptional but the other two items were average. 

I would highly recommend their fish tacos!

I had a flight to SF that was departing from a gate near this place and wanted to grab a bite before I boarded.  It looked like a cool place and offered some menu items that looked good.  After browsing the menu, I ordered:

Nitro Nachos, $8.95
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/sir-vezas-taco-garage-phoenix?select=b0HbdLhmPl7Lmj8L7E8yJA#b0HbdLhmPl7Lmj8L7E8yJA
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/sir-vezas-taco-garage-phoenix?select=Snw9oAxwcW-qlb-bUIeASQ#Snw9oAxwcW-qlb-bUIeASQ

Quesadilla, $6.95 + Peppers, $2
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/sir-vezas-taco-garage-phoenix?select=Lualv9KuNGft6MChnGZwpg#Lualv9KuNGft6MChnGZwpg

1L Water, $3

The Nachos were pretty good, but messy.  I had to eat 1/2 of the dish with a fork because the bottom half was soaked in Queso Cheese.  I don't recommend ordering this to take on a plane....it's not plane friendly as you will get messy.

The Quesadilla was very interesting.  I ordered it with the Peppers, which was an additional $2....it actually came with Peppers & Onions.  It tasted like an Italian Pepper & Onions Sandwich.....which was good, but unexpected.

Overall, I thought the food was pretty good for airport food.

Return Factor - 75%

Visiting Arizona with some friends and came here for taco Tuesday. Our waiter Corbin was awesome and we got a good seat for watching some basketball. He gave us some good recommendations for tacos! Corbin also was considerate and telling us when our orders are coming out a little bit late.

Stumbled across a Living Social deal and couldn't wait to try this new Mexican restaurant. 

Ordered the Stuffed Chipotle Chicken (chipotle cream, corn tamale stuffed, poblano) with a side of calabacitas and black beans. SO delicious!!! 

I came here during the lunch hour and our waitress Christin was friendly and knowledgable. Also, the food came out very quick and perfect for a lunch rush. 

Didn't get an opportunity to try any of the cocktails, but they seem to have a great Happy Hour menu with cheap drinks and eats. We'll be sure to come here for Happy Hour soon. 

They have only been open for 4 months and are having their Grand Opening at the end of March. Get in before it gets too busy, because this place is going to be rockin' in no time. 


Gracias Sir Veza!!!!

Sit at the bar to get good service. The corn dip was not good, bland and jus a can of sweet corn thrown in really. I was quickly given the edamame and that was good. It could've used more heat so I got sliced jalape√±os. Overall, jus what u would imagine a mall rest/bar to be. Not a destination but a fun stop off.  Wanted to give an extra star for the bar staff but the food......

I really do like this place, this is my third time coming here and it's always been good. This third time I have came however was a bit different the staff seem confused and a little slow with the drinks and food, mind you this is the day after thanksgiving. Overall still a good place to check out good food good times the indoor decor is also really cool give you a an old rustic garage feel. This place gets the Carlos one thumb up.
I love this place! And the bartender Kendall is the bestest ever!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Been here in the past, for lunch and they UFC events. Their food is pretty good however they servers seem to not be consistent. Being her over 20 mins , finding bugs in two of my drinks and no round chips and salsa. I wish that she had offered me a free drink or something for the wait and inconvenience.  The enjoy the mood here. Great TVs for sports and spaced out with out tables to close by.
Matt R is AMAZING!!! So friendly!!! So attentive!! Has great recommendations on the menu! The food is ALWAYS good here!

I needed lunch during a layover. Unfortunately, PHX doesn't have many options. So I settled on this place. The decor was fun and the menu LOOKED good. But it is best not to judge a book by its cover. 

First, we ordered the sliders. I was starving but my wife just wanted a snack. Figuring the sliders might be enough to satisfy us both, we ordered them. You get TWO sliders for $8. They were flavorless, but not terrible.

Because that didn't satisfy my hunger, I went back and ordered the nachos. Nachos, how hard could that be? Ok, these were TERRIBLE! The cheese, wasn't cheese. And it didn't even come close to tasting like cheese. The meat certainly didn't look like meat. And the chips weren't very good either. I've never done this before, but I actually returned them. I wasn't about to pay $12 for the 2 terrible bites my wife and I took. 

Find another place, you won't be happy eating here.
Huge portions and tasty stuff. Trust the bartender, she knows what to recommend.

Better than average airport food. I had breakfast tacos. I wish they had cooked the bacon more but I enjoyed the mix of flavors. 

They serve a good beer selection in red solo cups. Also have PHX local beer Kilt Lifter

Sirnoran Dog $8.95
Applewood bacon, 100% angus beef hot dog and old school fries.

Fries - crinkle cut and seasoned with salt & pepper 

Dog - mayo mustard beans tomatoes , very delicious.  I also added green chile sauce and cut up that grilled pepper that was on the side.  Wow that was spicy, my lips are burning.  

Awesome!!
Chicken burrito.  Chicken boiled more than grilled.  Strange mini rice, but had black beans.  Corona light on tap!

We visited Sir Veza's for the first time and were attracted to it by the fun music and atmosphere! The food was amazing and our waiter Matthew was so kind and helpful. He recommended he Diablo shrimp tacos and they were amazing. Prices were reasonable too. Highly recommend this place and will be back!

This place sucks, shredded beef looks like it was soaking in water, it was bland, had to eat it with jalape√±os just to get some taste, the tacos were weird looking and the nacho cheese was yucky not like the cheese in good Old San Antone. Will not return Hasta la Vista Baby

I waited for about 5 min at the bar which didn't even have a bartender behind it. When the bartender arrived, she pleasantly took my drink order, but then helped two ppl after me (poured a soda for a kid at the bar and then closed out a check). It's not like airport bars are amazing, but this level of service was pretty poor. Oh well, beer in hand now : )

The worst tacos they should be called second hand tacos! I was on a short lunch break and told the waitress I wanted two tacos to go. She insisted on putting in an order for a meal stating that it was cheaper (I doubt it). I asked for light onions and instead they gave me light cilantro and what looks like extra onions. Before eating I thought about returning it and getting what I asked for but had too much difficulty and decided to try them out. Omg let's just say these greasy Carne Asada tacos taste more like a breakfast sausage! I would return them but my pride is too big and I wouldn't dare want the little waitress to think it was about the price since I inquired about single tacos vs a meal:(

Had dinner at Sir Veza and I have to say review of this place is 1 out o f 5.  The food was not very good, margarita was very weak, rice tasted like it came from a box. No flavor in the Carne asada tacos, shrimp was good. My sons chimi very dry and bland. The waiter was not customer service friendly. Never again will we go, only positive thing was the manager discounted 22% off the bill.

I have been to Sir Veza's two times now and I am only mildly impressed. The service has been pretty good but the food is just okay. My fiance has really enjoyed the burger's here but I have not liked either of the items I have tried. On our first visit I tried the Johnny Las Vegas roll which is kind of like a sushi style roll but it's not seafood. Instead it is a mixture of chicken, cream cheese, jalapeno, chipolte sauce and maybe a couple of other items thrown in all wrapped up in a chimichanga type of wrap. I did not care for this at all. It kind of tasted like chicken salad to me which I cannot stand. If you like chicken salad, you might like this, if you hate mushy texture, you will hate it.

I did also try the La Bomba soft pretzel with strips of poblano peppers and swiss cheese and served with nacho cheese dipping sauce and mustard, I did like this a lot. On our second visit which was on New Years day I tried the Sonoran Dog. I did not care for this either. For me the hot dog itself was way too salty. The beer battered fries are however delicious. On New Years day they also had a DJ at 7:30pm who was just bumping beats the entire time we were there. It seemed like he was trying to turn the place into a night club. The music selection was terrible, with rap songs melding into country. It was extremely off putting. My fiance and I could not carry a conversation because of the mini night club situation. The DJ was the only one dancing and was clearly enjoying himself very much.

If it were up to me I probably would not come back. My fiance does love the burger here so we will probably give it another shot. If we do come back I will try the tacos on the next visit. We will also probably come early in the day on a weekday. I'm not up for the rap/country/pop mash up night club.

This place is awesome. Carnitas burrito was amazing. Beer is priced very good and if it is your birthday you can get a free birthday shot. Sitting at the bar is the best seat in the house and of Chuck is your bartender you will not be disappointed. He knows his stuff and gets anything you want super fast. If you are contemplating coming here...DO IT!!!
Nice, laid-back place with decent food and drinks but expensive for what it is (outside of happy hour).

They made us wait 25 minutes for 4 vegan tacos and then brought the wrong ones.... I said to the waitress that I didn't want them remade because it took 25 minutes to make and I didn't want to wait another 25 minutes to get the correct tacos. She said " oh ok" and took the tacos away. 

The guacamole legit tasted watered down and I had to add salt, pepper and hot sauce to make it edible. 

This was a BAD experience and I'm not happy at all... when your kitchen messes up you should say something more than "OH OK" and you should also ensure that IF I was to get it remade it wouldn't take 25 freaking minutes for VEGAN TACOS.

What a piece of s*** company they sit there on the corner of the block and they can't even serve a man a drink accusing him of being drunk when he walked in there not knowing nothing so we left and we were at the Buffalo Wild Wings to everybody there leave that s*** alone and let them deal with the car out front what a piece of s*** company
Love the food. I highly recommend the tacos. I usually get the diablo shrimp. Way overpriced. Almost worth it the money, but I like to splurge so I go here often.
Affordable beer for an airport. The carnitas burrito was very filling and tasty. Definitely my favorite spot at Phx Sky Harbor airport!

This place is a bar and twice we had great service and twice terrible service. I think I remember getting so pissed once that I complained to the manager.  I particularly love the Diablo shrimp tacos that are half price on Tuesday. Very big and two filled me up. Once I tried to eat three tacos and it almost killed me. I don't like the beans but I like the rice. They give you a French fry alternative option with the tacos which are good I just don't like fries with my tacos cause you know mixing France and Mexico isn't a good idea. I also love the mango tea which is a good alternative to Pepsi which I won't drink. We tried the desert and I wasn't impressed it had ice cream and hot sauce which is too fancy for me.  Note this is my go to place for shrimp tacos.

My wife and I tried this place before a movie. I ordered the taco salad with chicken. It was HUGE but the chicken was cubed and NOT fresh at all. I ACTUALLY hurt my tooth on one piece. You can tell they make the batch early and then let it sit. Out food came in like 4 minutes.... So if fresh quality food matters to you. I would skip it. Now I have 3 stars because the waitress did handle it well. She got the manager and it was taken off our bill. They offered to replace but I just wanted popcorn at that moment. So I was happy with how they dealt with it. Maybe I got unlucky? I usually NEVER say anything because I get embarrassed. but this was gross. I am sad. I thought we found a new spot. We tipped the waitress based on the original bill since she did a good job fixing thing. Not her fault they cut corners on the kitchen.

Had a few hour layover on Phoenix and decided to sit down at this airport eatery ....let me tell you I've been through a lot of airports and I have very little expectations when it comes to airport food but this place was absolutely awesome bye far some of the best airport food I have ever had hands down !! You have to try the Nitro Nachos !!

If you enjoy being taken for an idiot and eating mediocre food in a nice atmosphere with cool music, this is the place to go. 
First, the restaurant is very charming with its old garage like style, and they play good music (Smashing Pumpkins made the lunch more pleasant). That, unfortunately, is almost the only positive thing I can say.

We ordered a Coke and an iced tea, and we got - a diet coke. We notified the waitress and she brought a new one and explained in detail how the soda machine doesn't really work at the moment. No problem, but the explanation did not make much sense to us. Admit that it was a mistake, say sorry, and everything would be okay.
We got some chips and salsa for free and they were tasty.

For food we got a shrimp burrito with Guacamole (that we asked to have inside the burrito) and the Diablo Chicken Salad. Guess what, the burrito came with the Guacamole on the side and, for whatever reason, the salad that goes into a burrito also on the side. Husband said it tasted okay.

My chicken salad however, where do I start... it was supposed to be the grilled chicken with Diablo sauce, sesame seeds, edamame, kale, avocado and dressing. It was entirely lettuce, a few lonely edamame, three slices of avocado with some brown spots, pretty dry chicken, and not a single piece of kale. The one great thing was the Diablo sauce which was fruity, sweet and really spicy. I notified the waiter about the lack of kale, she left the table and came back with a menu and said there's no kale in the salad, it says "edamame kale" and edamame kale are the few tiny beans in the salad. I highly doubted that there is something like edamame kale but who knows, nowadays everything suddenly comes in new fancy varieties, so maybe there is an edamame kale that looks and tastes like normal edamame. We googled immediately - guess what, there is no such thing as edamame kale. Nice try fooling the customer. We looked at the menu again and it clearly says it has edamame and kale. Seriously, if she had told me they're out of kale, ok, or they forgot it, ok. But making up a ridiculous new vegetable that doesn't exist... come on.... I almost threw a Gordon Ramsey in that place, but I'll get my revenge now with this review [insert evil laughter here]. 
So, I paid $12 for a bowl of lettuce and a good laugh about "edamame kale"...

To make a long story short, the food is a joke, especially for the prices and the waitress lies in your face instead of admitting even minor mistakes. We will definitely never come back.

I should have stuck with a quesadilla but changed it to nachos. I kept eyeing the man's quesadilla next to me. I was tempted to offer a switch yet that would be an odd offering by a stranger.

The chips itself were fine. More on the thin, crisp side than the thicker crunch type of chip. I got 1 tablespoon of guac which was saddening. I got more sour cream than that. I'm not sure if they know what pico de gallo is because I had just diced tomatoes...no onion or cilantro which is another disappointment! ( i looked at old pics and it looked like they used to make pico de gallo w onion and cilantro...they may have forgot today) They also use cheese sauce. I don't mind it at baseball games but I love real melted cheese like they use on quesadillas. I opted for refried beans which were dry and likely canned..assuming by taste. The chicken did not taste seasoned and was fairly bland. Overall I wouldn't order again. 

Next time I'm in the airport, I may try the brasserie..even though that's a few dollars more.

This was a lovely surprise in the world of airport food. We ordered one order of Carne Asada Tacos and one order of Fish Tacos. Both were very flavorful and seasoned well. Tacos seem to be one of those things that all restaurants think they can do, but this place really can make a good taco. My husband and I agreed that the fish tacos were our favorite of the two. Pricing seemed reasonable, especially for an airport location and our order came up without a long wait.

The girl working the register was too busy talking to her coworkers to get my order right or to remember to give me the soft drink I ordered, but the  Birria burrito I got instead of the breakfast burrito I ordered was awesome. Great food, poor service.

The service was great. The food was not impressive. For the price I paid for a sirnoran hot dog I was expecting better taste. The bun was cold, I personally like the bun to be warm. We also order a taco salad, the taste was much better than the hot dog but the ground beef was cold. I think for a bar it looks pretty cool and the service is awesome, our server and manager were great, but for food I will not be coming back.
Excellent Nachos. Car Club Tacos, chimi style burito. Gypsy Rose cocktail was delicious

One of the few places open for breakfast at Sky Harbor at 5:00 am. Cashier barely said a word and looked like she'd rather be anywhere else. I understand it's 5:00 am but if you're in the service industry some actual pleasantries should be expected. Oh yeah the food is pretty sub-par. As one who travels frequently I've tried the sliders and burrito and had better stuff out of a microwave.

Dropped into Sir Veza's Taco Garage on Thanksgiving morning with my family on the way out to California. Did not eat anything; this was about some liquid holiday cheer! 

Everything is served in Red Solo cups to keep track on who has a beverage, if ya catch my drift. 

Aside from the Tang, our bartender made a pretty good mimosa. Negra Modelo on tap. 

Also, the guy thought I had a Minnesota accent. Too funny. At the very least, thanks for giving this Northern California lady a good laugh! 

Prices seemed typical for airport drinks; however, when your awesome Pops is footing the bill . . . Who cares?!

Although the chicken bowl I ordered had decent flavor, the chicken was absolutely dry, which kind of stinks. I feel like the price you pay is based on the meat, and if the meat is yucky, you just paid for pretty much nothing. Plus, they give you a little packet of salsa in a little plastic container like BBQ sauce from a fast food restaurant. That's when you know it's not good, fresh salsa, and you probably shouldn't open it unless you're desperate. I left mine in the bag. The price is rather high for what you get, which many reviews on here state. I should've read reviews prior to ordering, but it was enough food for me at that moment in time. I don't know when I'll be in Phoenix again, but I highly doubt I'd be going back to this place if I do.

Stopped by on the way to a flight. Place my order and waited several minutes for the to go order. The girl (Destiny) called the number and by the time I got to the window she called final call and continued to argue with me back and forth 4-5 times saying she has called the number 3 times and its was now final. I asked if she had a bag for the to go order and she said yes and set the bag next to the order. I reminded Destiny that typically the customer is always right and she continued to argue then ignore. Discussed with manager and he refunded the money. I still would like to let the customer here beware of the young girl behind the counter. She is rude and I'm sure since its an airport location will go unnoticed by her employer.

So first off I feel it's important to say that this place is in the airport, which I feel colors the review. All in all the place is good for its location. That and the ability to leave an airport eatery with fairly interesting food and a good beer for $15 is pretty good. 

The style of the place is a hipster chipotle. Flavor is pretty good and not that inventive. Options are tacos, burritos and bowls w/ the same meat options as chipotle. So why not go to chipotle?  2 reasons, 1. There isn't one and 2. The beer. Again the beer.

So they have 20 different beers on tap, locales and national micro brews. They allow taste before you buy and are pretty good. 

3 on its merits, 4 because of an airport.

Experience at Sir Veza's on Aug 10th, 2017...a little late on writing this! I eat a Plant-Based Diet and was looking for a bite before my flight. I came across this place and approached to find out what they've got for me. I initially began to order a Bowl, but made some changes (no cheese, etc). Deborah W recognized what I was omitting and with approval from her manager, changed it to "sides" instead, saving me some $ and time altering their menu item. I got black beans/pico/peppers/avocado and corn tortillas. They were delicious! And Deborah was so sweet and patient with the order.

This place is hit or miss... but when it's on, it's on. The shrimp diablo tacos are fantastic. The only thing lacking is the consistency with the food and service. 

Love the bar and the tequila selection is pretty awesome.

Fish tacos from a tex-mex place IN AN AIRPORT?!?!

Call me desperate or call me calculated, but this place had some pretty darn good fish tacos!  Fresh tasting fish, tasty garnishes, and 4 flat screen TVs make this an ideal spot for me...and apparently a lot more people...the place was packed!

I was just tired of paying $15 for a $1.99 egg muffin style sandwich at SFO, so I held out until the flight landed in phoenix.

With a long layover and a growling stomach, I accepted the fact that I would need to eat somewhere...now I can't wait to come back!

Happy Eating!

I went during happy hour and stayed for about 30 minutes. Everything was about average. The food to me taste more like Barfood. For some reason I was expecting higher quality food. Same with the beverages. The new trendy thing is to use fresh fruits and beverages not syrupy concentrates. I ordered and was a bit disappointed in the quality of product I received. I probably would not go back.

Sky Harbor is the best airport I have been to in terms of food. With quality offerings like Four Peaks, Humble Pie and La Grande Orange you have some great choice. I am adding another great little spot for your consideration with Sir Veza's. Tacos, burritos, salads and even burgers are on the menu. I ordered two chicken tacos with a side of black beans and rice. The tacos come wrapped in two soft corn tortillas (they also offer flour), grilled chicken topped with a chipotle crema, cilantro,  queso fresco, and fajita veggies. The crema had heat and made their salsa toppings irrelevant. The tacos are big so please don't be scared of the high price tag, you will be full. They are very generous with the protein and if you can find a seat in the crowded dining room you are all set.

We were at the mall and wanted to try something new so we stop into Sir Veza's.  We got a table very quickly, I think there staffing ratio was 3 to 1, perhaps training.  Although this didn't provide good service.   When ordering a beer say glass not pint the waitress didn't know what a pint was the size.  Also make sure you are very specific on your beer order otherwise you will get the wrong one (as I did).  We try a few appetizers, mistake the first was covered in cheese whiz with a dollop of sour cream, I thing there were French fry bit swimming in there but wasn't sure.  The Jalape√±o chicken sliders weren't too bad, but the onion straws with them were under cooked (no crunch at all).  And because of our massive food order it took a while for the food to arrive at our table.  And even though this place had a whack of staff obtaining a refill of salsa or chips was not an easy task.  I would not go back.

This is our first time coming back and we were so thrilled to see our absolutely favorite server ever JOE!!! He is truly the best server I have ever met. You will not be disappointed if you ask for Joe.

When your flight has been delayed because too many planes are trying to get into Phoenix for the big game - it's nice to have places to kill some time at and grab a little something to eat too!

This place - at least when I was there - had great staff, the pricing wasn't bad - food tasted great and they were not slow - even though I had time to kill. Seemed clean, but it was just really the same ole same ole. However, I wouldn't hesitate to return!

Perhaps more for a drink than a dinner!

Awesome service, not so happy with the food.

I wouldn't say I'm a huge fan of Sir Veza's but I've been reasonably happy with what I've eaten at the restaurant in Chandler and the one in Tucson. But of course, just like other places that have gone into PHX lately, the airport incarnation fell short of the original. My husband got a burrito and customized it to be low carb (relatively speaking). They were willing to substitute the onions and peppers that come on the tacos in place of the rice and beans in the burrito, which was nice. However, they definitely did not add any extra meat and so the burrito was still pretty small and mostly tortilla. I also attempted to be healthy and ordered a taco salad which was anything but. Apparently they make it with a friend greasy flour tortilla smeared with refried beans at the bottom. Which wouldn't have been so bad if it wasn't for the fact that there was a woefully small amount of lettuce. And it was of the wilted iceberg variety. However, to their credit they did remember to leave off the sour cream so that was much appreciated. 

The main reason they earned three stars was the staff. The woman who took our order was friendly, efficient, and helpful. Another girl was working hard to keep the place clean in spite of the crowds and even got me an ice tea refill. That was good since our flight departure ended up being delayed so I had plenty of time to drink it.

I got the fish tacos here and they were excellent! Not sure about the rest of the menu, but looks like your basic run-of-the-mill TexMex joint.  Not bad for an airport, and right next to a fantastic coffee spot!

Super fun and our new Friday night spot! Love DJ, all dance music and good vibes! Matt was amazing and was attentive all 4 hours we were there! Michelada's are amazing, burnt Brussels and ribs are top notch!

I have to say I am pleasantly surprised. I ordered the bean dip to start with the chips and salsa. It was delicious. The chips and salsa were OK but not that good.  I ordered the nachos. When they came out they were huge.  They were filling and tasty.  The server we had was awesome. He was running back and forth to make sure we always had everything we needed.  Needless to say we tipped him well.  The ambiance of the restaurant is great because it is kind of inside, but no walls so you can see outside.  The have a DJ every day.  I feel bad because they are in the infamous cursed location of Chandler Mall.  No place ever lasts there. I can't say I for sure would eat here again without the Living Social deal I got for this restaurant. It is a little pricey.  The Nachos are definitely worth the money, but from what I can see on the Yelp pictures it looks like everything else may be a little overpriced.

I got the bowl [which comes with guacamole, blak beans, rice, salsa, cilantro, chipotle crema] and for the meats I chose Barbacoa and carnitas. I wasn't expecting much for the quantity, the quality is average. Didn't have much meat in my bowl. If you're looking for airport food that'll satisfy your hunger for an hour or two, get what I got! Good for those who don't want to be on the plane with a full stomach. =]

So the fish tacos? FREAKIN' AH-MAZING! 
But the communication between the FOH & BOH was basically non-existent. 

I'm sure things would run a lot more smoothly if they worked together more.
The food was disgusting and it made me ill. Ordered eggs and they didn't even taste like eggs.

Most don't go to the airport and expect great food or cheap drinks.  Even with lowered expectations this place fails to meet.  I have been to this airport several times, found several places that I would return without issues.   This one was not one of them.

I walked all the way to the C terminal to try this place out. My flight was out of the B terminal. Staff was nice and sweet. I had the chicken tacos and a local brew. Tortillas were soft but the filling was delish'

The taco salad was awful. Refried beans looked like they came straight out of the can, not heated. Couldn't tell if beef was ground chunks or pieces and no salsa....
Slider burgers were all filler. 
Panera has got to be better if you have to stand with your food.

1 star for the good fries. Food was tasteless: My husband's hamburger was over cooked and very dry (even though he ordered it 'pink in the middle'), my son's burger was dry bun with tiny piece of meat and cheese. Pork and fish tacos were lacking seasonings, however compared to the hamburgers were ok. Probably this is good 'happy hour' place but don't waste your money on the food.

I'm sitting a couple of feet away from Sir Veza's as I wait for my flight to board. I had some time to kill and was very interested in a drink and at this gate Sir Veza's satisfied both of those requirements. Their menu is simple, I ordered a burrito with grilled chicken and a "sky harborita". Their layout is kind of weird because anywhere you stand to wait for your food and drink will be blocking either people getting drinks at the bar or people behind you waiting to order. 

Anywho, I got my burrito and drink and after a few minutes snagged a seat at a table. The harborita did it's job for $5 and the burrito was actually pretty good. Black beans, cheese, rice, meat, and a side of chile verde which was flavorful and I'm glad I dipped my burrito in it. If the burrito ($7.95) were a dollar cheaper or a little bigger, I probably would have no complaints. This is a pretty good joint and would eat here again
Not impressed. Not only did they bring me the wrong order but when it was corrected, new dish was cold. Very expensive and do not plan on coming back.

This is my go to spot to eat when I fly out of Phx, AZ. Its located by the gate so its real convenient. According to the other reviews I guess Im the only one who orders the cheeseburger sliders with fries and an Ice tea!
Been here three time and haven't had a bad meal yet. The folks are very nice, you stand in line and they call you when its done. there is limited seating but i've always found a seat. or folks can go out into the seating area and eat as well.
The sliders are cooked just right, not dry with just the right amount of greasiness! The fries are very crispy and not over salted, Plus they don't put pepper on them, don't like pepper on my fries.
Just the right amount of food to make it to Atlanta! the price is a bit high but its an airport restaurant. What do you expect? Anyway I'll be back!

This is definitely one of my favorite places to visit in Arizona. What more can you ask for. Shopping, alcohol and good food. I love that they are located right in the mall.  Their Mechiladas are delicious and refreshing. The outdoor seating is very comfortable.

I have been a longtime patron of Sir Veza's Taco Garage; it is the only part of traveling that I enjoy. I looked forward to getting a breakfast burrito from Sir Veza's before jumping on a long flight across the country. Everything was great! Until I talked them up to my family and insisted we go get a breakfast burrito before a family vacation to Minnesota. I was so excited for them to try it. Well, my wife wasn't hungry, so she didn't order, just my brother and I ordered. The burritos came out astonishingly fast, as they usually do. My brother and I began devouring our burritos until after the second bite we looked at the now chewed off ends of the burrito. To our horror, we saw green eggs. Before you ask dear Yelpers, it was not St. Patrick's Day, and there was not a special Dr. Seuss promotion going on. 

My brother was worried he would now get sick on our flight, and so was I. We googled what it meant to get green scrambled eggs and found a few answers. It was likely cooked at too high a temperature on an iron based cook top or pan. The combination of the two causes the yolks to oxidize and creates sulfur dioxide or iron oxide or something like that (go ask Bill Nye). It is perfectly safe to eat, though the sulfur laden fart smell is hard to choke down. We did not end up getting sick. 

What has made me sick is the arduous process my wife has had to go through to get our refund processed. We were told by a "manager" that the refunds would go through in a couple days. We went on vacation for eight days and didn't think much about it. When we got back to Phoenix (late at night, after Sir Veza's was closed), the refund still hadn't processed. Now, we are talking ten or eleven dollars here. Not exactly breaking anyone's bank, but my wife and I try and live by some simple principles, and one is never to pay for something you didn't receive.

I called the store on July 13th, 2015 to ask about the refund. The manager I spoke with said she would look into the issue and call me back. No call on Tuesday. No call on Wednesday. So my wife called. She spoke to a woman named Maria who told her employee to say she wasn't there and to take a message (yes Maria, my wife could hear everything you were saying). Maria identified herself as the assistant manager.

Maria claimed that she called me and left a message, she did not. My wife asked to verify the phone number Maria had called (my wife is an indefatigable defender of truth and honesty) and the question was brushed aside almost expertly by the "assistant" manager. Maria tried hard to get out of having to do anything at all but agreed to call the district office. She would then call me the following day when the transaction was complete (I still have not received a phone call). Satisfied that we would finally get some justice (because we really could care less about $10/$11), My wife agreed to let bygones be bygones; but not before she asked if Maria had found that phone number she allegedly called and left a message for me. Remember my wife's tenacity? Maria blurted out a number that wasn't even close and kind of trailed off at the end. Do phone numbers now only have six digits?

There has been NO resolution. My wife called again today and found out from an ill-informed employee that Maria is, in fact, the GM of the area. We have been told that everything should be resolved today and that I will get a phone call when it has been submitted. I am not holding my breath. What's that saying? If a dog bites you once? Well... Hopefully, the same principle doesn't apply to green eggs or general managers named Maria...

I have nothing against Sir Veza's food despite my experience. I understand that mistakes happen and that being unreasonable about situations never helps get the results you want. My wife also understands this. In fact, she would tell you, despite all the pains, that Sir Veza's at Sky Harbor Airport makes the best Bloody Marry in Phoenix. We are simply upset that we have been brushed aside by this company's employees and management over a measly amount of money.

There was only one apology in this whole debacle that I am aware of. When the manager (it may have been Maria for all I know) originally tried to process the refund. She said, "Sorry... we just got new eggs". To which I thought, "Did we get the old ones then"?

So I, along with four of my colleagues and my brother, are swearing you off. It breaks my heart. Though, companies with terrible customer appreciation/service don't deserve our business. A little gratitude and sympathy could have gone a long way. A simple, "I'm sorry this has been such a difficult process" would have spoken volumes to their dedication to retaining a loyal customer base. Instead, we are all done with you. Well... except my wife, she is steadfast in her determination to get a refund. Also, she will be back for a Bloody Marry next time she travels. Seriously. They are that good.

Wow, unfortunately what a let down.  

This was my second visit came here a while back for some drinks and had a pleasant experience I figured we'd stop again and this time try some tacos.  Place wasn't busy my any means as there were tables open. We sat at the bar top.  

The bar top was filthy, food crumbs and dirty glasses everywhere not just where we were sitting.  The bar tender came and I thought he'd wipe the top down. Nope my mistake for thinking he would do it without me having to ask.   I look over to the end of the bar and the entire corner was evidently conquered by an army of dirty dishes, pint glasses, plates, and pitchers.  The bar tender just went about his business taking orders and ignoring the mess. He brought us our beers and once again didn't even make an attempt to wipe away the previous three meals that were all over the top.  

My desire to eat quickly faded, as I wondered if they were this messy out in the open I can only imagine how filthy they are behind the scenes.   

Such a disappointment as this place has potential and I like the garage decor and feel.  But I will never go back to a place that blatantly disregards cleanliness.
The chip's and Salsa are good, but the happy hour sliders were not all that great. I ordered a Mango Margarita and my waitress for got to put my order in so I never got it.

I was stuck in the Phoenix International Airport for 2.5 hours longer than expected during a flight delay one Saturday evening and was getting hungry. After walking around checking out all the different restaurants in the terminal I finally found Sir Vesas.

There aren't too many good places to eat in this airport (but plenty of average ones) so I chose Sir Vesas for the three star average and their more than one Vegetarian Option. I ordered the Bean and Cheese Burrito and it was about $7 which isn't too expensive for airport food. The burrito was pretty good. Black beans, cheese, sour cream and salsa inside a flour tortilla. Nothing bad, nothing great. Just ok.

I might come back to Sir Vesas again if I was in the same terminal at Phoenix International. I wouldn't traverse multiple terminals to get here, but if I was there then it's not a bad option. They have a nice bar area as well as a small seating area which makes for a nice place to relax if you can find a spot.

We had a layover and looked forward to a nice cup of soup while waiting. What we got was a salt lick of tortilla soup and when we attempted to alert the counter server, Trisha, of our dislike, we were dished up a huge helping of bad attitude. Total rudeness topped with no eye contact.

This was not at all what we expected. What happened to service with a smile?

We cannot recommend Sir Veza's to any future terminal 4 visitors.
