My experience here was nothing spectacular but overall decent. I sat at the bar and had a cheese crisp with green chilis and a sangria. They make their own sangria daily and it was good, not too sweet and they even offered to sub the sprite for club soda. Great bartenders, crisp chips and good salsa.

It was the perfect segue from a hot car to some serious shopping at Macy's

We love Mexican and are pretty picky about it. I have been here twice and thought it was excellent both times! The margaritas and chips and salsa are both delicious! (And that's the true test of yummy Mexican right?!) I had the chopped salad and it was very good. Huge portion. The kids meals have great options which we love as well. Service was great both times we went.  I'm a fan!

Beverages are only offered in plastic cups! This is such an immense contribution to the plastic pollution problem. In an establishment that does not offer beers "to go", there is no excuse not to use glass.

We visited this place on Cinco de Mayo. We came a bit later after their events and music must have taken place, and were seated almost right away. Our server was nice and energetic and made some great recommendations for food and beverage options. I ordered one of the specialty margaritas, the Gypsy Rose, that had Patron Silver, prickly pear and lime. It was just the perfect amount of sweet and sour. I also ordered a second marg at happy hour, a strawberry marg on the rocks. Also delicious.

We ordered the chimi bites and the $2 tacos on Tuesday. The chimi bites were amazing. The $2 tacos....not so much. I was almost full when I got them, but I thought they lacked flavor. I want to try some of the regular plate tacos next time because those sounded really great. The "new" shredded beef or chicken tacos look delicious.

For the price and the variety of specials, this place is a good find!

This place is AWESOME!! I'm never in this area but there are tons of options to go eat. Let me tell you this should be on your list. It's really cool (just like a mechanic shop) and the food is pretty good. I recommend
If you're really hungry, don't hesitate to eat here!  There's a lot of food.  The service couldn't really get any better either.  Not a bad experience!  I'd say 4 stars is about right.
Worst burrito I've ever had! Stale tortilla, undercooked rice, poorly cooked vegetables, zero seasoning. You give them $9 and they give you something to throw directly in the trash.

Sir Veza's has great happy hour prices with drinks and appetizers very affordable!  I, however, ordered a dinner of two tacos with charro beans instead of refried.

My friends who ordered off of the HH menu all got the bbq pork sliders which came with two sliders and fries--$5!!!

I, who ordered off of the regular menu, was able to choose from about 8-10 different fillers for my tacos.  I chose the shredded chicken and the carne asada which is a dollar more.  The shredded chicken was really good, but I wouldn't recommend the carne asada--too dry and small chunks of steak.  (Maybe I'm not a carne asada fan.)  They let me get more beans because I don't eat white rice.  I also liked that I could get charro beans (but not the kind I'm used to) instead of refried beans.

It's a fun place and attracts a young crowd.

Got to this Taco Garage before a morning flight.  No line and I initially intended to grab a protein drink and yoghurt.  I saw breakbeat bowls on the menu so figured that would fit in my low carb diet.  The cashier asked if there anything I did NOT want in it from the list of options.  I asked for no carbs and no sour cream.  I was this expecting eggs, turkey sausage, cheese, black beans, jalape√±os. 
After waiting about 10 minutes I was given a large container with the above and 90% tortilla chips!

WTF and what a rip off since most of the container was the chips.  I picked out what I could. Check the picture attached.

My first instinct was to discount this place based on its cheesy name, but the lure of a Groupon brought me in. And oh my goodness, it was delicious! 

I tried 3 tacos (the beef with zucchini was my favorite), and my lady got the SirNoran dog. Holy cow, what a hot dog! We will definitely be back!

Passing through Phoenix airport and ordered a vegetarian bowl.  It cost more than $8 and I left a tip.  Opened the bowl to find about 1/3 cup of rice and 1/3 cup of black beans, plus a sprinkle of fajitas and a tablespoon of sour cream and tablespoon of guacamole.  In other words, it was very, very little food for the price I paid.  Also it was quite greasy and over-salted.  

Airport food, sigh.

Amazing service and great carne asada. I wish this was a restaurant I could go to at home. The service was great. The bartender tonight was super sweet and made sure the whole bar was taken care of. Cashier was also great! 
Carne asada bowl was delicious. Meat was tender and flavors were great. Fantastic atmosphere for the World Series!

Nice addition to all the food options at the Chandler Mall .. located next to the food court by the valet.

I've been to the 2 locations in Tucson also and they never disappoint.. 

On today's visit I had a jack & Coke with a generous pour.. yum! I then saw a michelada being fixed across the bar and I had to have one .. you need two hands too lift this baby off the bar .. they dunk the beer bottle in it and the rim has the lime spice .. tajin.. delish and very filling!!

For lunch I had two grilled fish tacos, with a side of rice & charro beans.. tasty.. I had the mamacita hot sauce for some kick. 

The menu and happy hour menus have tons of great options .. the staff checks on you regularly.. good stuff!

If you ever find yourself waiting for your flight and you're 21, spend that time at Sir Vezas with a michelada. It's absolutely delicious! It's not a fully stocked bar but you can choose from beer, wine, margaritas and bloody mary's. Food was as good as bar food gets. I had a steak bowl that was almost as good as chipotle. New favorite airport spot :)

What a beer for $3!  Yep, at Sir Veza's.  The help started by asking us if we wanted a quiet location which we did.  That's important because there's karaoke here.  We ordered a mix of drinks from wine to beer to margaritas.  All were good.  For dinner, I ordered a burrito covered in red sauce.  It was excellent and really too much for one person.  My wife had a pulled pork taco and a veggie taco.  Both tacos were good.  We choose this restaurant because it was close to our hotel but glad we found it.  We'll be back during the next Spring Training.

As far as airport food goes, this is pretty daggone good  I've had the carnitas breakfast tacos (corn) twice and they are delish as well as great hangover food. It would be THAT much better if the salsa were fresh, but it's not terrible. 

Prices are fair too. It's pretty filling - can't completely finish them - out the door it's about $12.

It's hard to fail at nachos, and I had the blandest nachos I've ever had, despite the beans, cheese, jalape√±os, guac, sour cream, and pico de gallo piled on top. I'm not even sure which topping it was that tasted like cardboard because it ALL kinda tasted like variations of paper. 

The space is small, and you order and then stand around blocking everybody else while you wait for your number to be called so then you can nudge your way back to the front. 

I'm only adding a star because they seemed to have a decent beer variety on tap, although I didn't get any because there was no place to eat inside the premises.

Bartender by the name of Giovanni greeted us with the worst customer service ever. We went to sit at the bar and have a couple drinks before our connection and we were greeted with " Just to let you folks know that if someone comes up and wants to drink I have to ask you to find another seat. " I looked at my husband very confused because that was our plan to get drinks.   So I looked at him and said what makes you think that's not what we were going to do? He said "I don't know what your plan is, I just have to tell you that."  My husband looks at him and says "I have never been greeted like that walking into a restaurant or up to a bar before."  He looked right at us and said "I'm sure the full service bar down the way would love to serve you guys".  I was completely dumbfounded as to what had just occurred. We had actually been to this same restaurant two nights ago while flying through and had great service and good food from a female bartender.  I said "we were just here two nights ago and had much better service." .  He said " well I wasn't here".  My husband looked right at him and said "no, no you weren't and we will be taking our business to that full service bar down the way just like you recommended, have a good night".   If there was a no star option trust me that is what it would get!

Best vegan fajitas I've ever had. We told Sierra we were in a hurry and she made sure everything came out quickly. She was also super knowledgeable about the menu, extremely attentive, and so so nice! The food was excellent, but Sierra is the reason for 5 stars!

What a great spot @ the Chandler Mall.
Stopped in yesterday while taking a break from shopping.

Bartender greeted us right away & we requested to sit out side on the patio & people watch. 

Our server came quickly and took our drink orders. Got the Diablo Wings & Queso Dip. Great prices throughout the menu. The Happy Hour deals you can't beat. $4.95 for many popular appetizers. Delish eats, however the wing sauce was a little sweeter than we had expected. Would have liked more heat! Still delicious! 

Prickly Pear iced tea is unusually tasty & a much try!

A fun place! Great concept which gears itself as a garage style atmosphere. The napkins are actual red mechanics rags! 

The wait staff friendly. Attentive and professional.

Nice menu choices and fair prices.

My friends wanted to try this place for the first time on his birthday and it ended up being a horrible experience. After two drinks they cut everyone off! So we decided to leave of course and the staff over heard where we were going and called that bar to tell them not to serve us! Unbelievable! We did nothing wrong, were very calm and polite and I can tell you, no one was near drunk off of two drinks! We will never go there again.

Just tried this place for the first time and love it! The enchiladas that came in a skillet were amazing.  My husband had the carne asada burrito which was really good as well.   No gristle like some places have.   We really enjoyed the music too.   Great food and atmosphere.  We'll definitely be back.   P.S. And a quick shout out for the chips and salsa ;-)

Pretty good for airport food! I had fish tacos and they were definitely fresh and tasted good. There was also a decent amount of fish in the tacos. I wish it came with guacamole though, that would have made them a lot better. Also, they're are a bit on the smaller side so if you're really hungry, one order may not suffice. Luckily, I only needed a light lunch, and these tacos hit the spot. I think the tacos have the least bang for your buck compared to the burritos or the bowls (I could get a lot more food at Chipotle for the cost of the two tacos I got), but I was really craving tacos so I went for it. However, I would come back if I was ever in Phoenix again.
Fun place with a great atmosphere, good food and great drink specials. Definitely a good place for a happy hour aka Garage Sale. Will definitely come back again.

Well damn, over $16 for 8 mini chimi bites, and a beer.

The bites had very little filling, but were otherwise tasty.

Even for being inside the terminal, the price was high.

I only eat in the airport when I'm delayed, as I was this evening.

Might return, but odds aren't high.

Actually didn't try the food. Stopped into to grab something to eat after a long day of travel. Bartender closing down his register,  kitchen was getting cleaned up, waitresses were closing out and and doing side work.  When I  asked if the restaurant is still open the rude bartender pointed at the gate across from me and said when that plane leaves they close.  

I walked out of there, who wants to eat at a place that is 99 percent closed down and on top of that they weren't even inviting and said hey we're closing down but don't worry about it,  come on in and grab something we will take care of you.

Stay open till you close.
The 5 stars is solely based on their Bloody Mary. Comes in a red cup and its spicy upon request. Perfect before a flight.

I know this spot is cursed, due to many restaurants closing at this spot. However, this place seems like the new touch of tuscon desert needs and fills a valid role in Chandler fashion square. To be honest I was not willing to go at first and got dragged here by my significant other. To explain the service I doubt I could do it justice. They were willing to let us sample all their flavors from cheese to several of the beers before deciding. They were very attentive and caring for a chain restaurant. I understand this is the fifth in the chain. The food was great. Actually the portions were larger than expected and the flavor was not skipped. I have tried at least three of the tacos. Not to mention diet friendly for my vegan and gluten free friends. Just wow. I don't normally dish out a four star rating a first time but this place really has it. Even the rice is good. Something most places overlook. It's blooming with cilantro and flavor.

Second time we ate here at Chandler mall.  The service sucks and the food is worse. I don't think this place will last long. Even the manager comped us drinks because the food was so bad and the servers kept walking by.  What a dump!
Not a fan. The food is just not that great. The restaurant is pretty cool though, I'd definitely drink here!

The menu said they have Vegan,Vegetarians andGF option...this place is a joke.
Order a vegan option and it came with some chicken and shreds cheese in it , seems like the people in the kitchen are not aware of what cross contamination is or the difference between vegan vegetarian. 
We tried the place again because we enjoy the atmosphere, order a 3 tacos pkate vegan option and again found  meat in it.
If you have different options on the menu you need to know the right way to prepare the food.
Very dissapoited, we won't be back for sure

Got the bacon breakfast taco on a layover. Pretty odd and greasy-the tortilla was fried on the griddle, I believe. Definitely not a traditional breakfast taco, the salsa was closer to ketchup. I can't comment on the other food options, so the stars are for breakfast tacos only. The service was friendly, though.
My second time here and the food is very consistent. .the prices are great the service is wonderful and the staff is very friendly. .must stop in

High hopes, big let down. :( 
We came on a slow Sunday afternoon hoping for a fun girls lunch. Unfortunately service was slow, drinks were either all ice or really watered down... heir bloody Mary's were translucent pink... sad. Food was bland. Tacos were solar to what I make at home... not worth the money. :( 

Only plus was good 90s music and chips and salsa.

Cool place to hang out at the mall. We will definitely be back to watch games and hang at the bar. The garage theme is cool, and it'll be great to hang out on the patio in the spring.  The shrimp tacos and carne asada tacos were excellent. portions are big, not those little sample size tacos. Try it out if you are at the mall or looking for a good place to day drink or go for happy hour!

Stumbled in here on a Thursday as I was leaving the mall, to my surprise found out every tequila is half priced..EVERY Thursday! The bartender Colby was super sweet and told me a ton about the background of some of the menu items and cocktails. Although I heard they are known for their gourmet street tacos I took a risk and ordered the Shrimp Stuffed Chile Rellano and man I'm sure happy I did! It had bacon, avocado, tomatoes, queso fresco and so much more goodness inside.  In addition to the classic sides of rice and beans they also included a zucchini and squash blend that was served in some sort of really taste sauce. I probably would of tried to squeeze in dessert if they're complimentary chips and salsa weren't so good! LOL 
Also the Pink Paloma margarita is served with this grapefruit soda in a massive glass and I highly recommend trying one! Everything was great, I will certainly be back next Thursday to try the tacos...and more tequila.

Usually a great place to go but today, not so much. Had a bartender ignore me to spend her time making free drinks to an employee drinking beside me.  The best part was an employee screaming "Mother f*cker" while standing at the food window with kids in the restaurant.  She laughed; cooks laughed. It was sad.  The only redeeming part was the bartender helping me...She was awesome:

Very cool taco and hot dog "garage"

I'm a new fan of Sir Veza's. Stumbled across the place when we decided to have lunch at the mall and yet wanted to avoid the food court. Yelp'd it and... What? A 4-star place here? Their food shall be had. Onward!

The concept is a garage restaurant-- garage decor, mechanics rags for napkins, staff in biker apparel, et al.  Cool look and vibe, along with lots of TVs to catch the games on while eating.

Menu is mainly tacos, salads, and a big sonoran hot dog. That latter was yummy as bucks. And the kids menu hit the spot with our little girls. 

A bit slow on the service and the young lady kept forgetting things in her rush. She was nice enough though and I forgive her attempt to give me diabetes with an Arnold Palmer so sweet that my relations felt the pucker. She's young and with some additional experience, she'll be rocking it.

We'll be back!

Absolutely the best place to have a beer in the Chandler Mall. I would suggest coming here before going to Kona which everyone goes to and they have limited beer menu. Taco Tuesdays half-off absolutely the best value in town love this place love the atmosphere love the service everything about this place is great.

I just read the reviews..... Kona is ok... really... but this place is
1. Funner 
2 better beers
3. Nice servers with fun upbeat attitude 
4 really professional
5. Did I say great attitude ...
6. Smart and very time motion conscience 

Love Kona.... sorta
Love this place much better
Happy Customer.  I had the Sonoran Dog with beer battered onion strings. Both were good.  The other item is a burrito with shaker style very big and very filling.  Margaritas as well.

Bar staff was great, food was on par, and the beer selection was also pretty impressive for an airport. There are no dishes in the place and they assume all food is "to-go" so almost every order comes in a Styrofoam container which was somewhat off-putting.

If you're saving money on BOH staff, one would think you could splurge on containers that are biodegradable. Pricing here was good too, so maybe using these containers is an excuse to keep the prices low, who knows.

Ultimately, I dug this place, it's just too bad they can't take it easy on those Arizona landfills. As a native, I know this state is not very environmentally minded and accept that this is a typical practice of the area which makes me a little sad.

Food: bland, small and way overpriced. I had the beef burrito blah

Atmosphere: cool, but small. I usually walk by this place and it's packed, but probably because there are only a few chairs at the bar

Service: horrible. 8am in the morning, 4 girls working and none of them had a friendly attitude. I was at the cash register ready to order for 30 seconds waiting for the girls to finish their conversation. No apology, no good morning, nothing... The pick up girl was just as unfriendly. Called my number for pickup and not a word.

This was my first and last visit.

There are almost no restaurants in this terminal, and this one was right next to my gate. I have been craving chips and queso, so I ordered some. I was very disappointed that it took 20 minutes to get a small take out box of chips and a teeny bit of queso on top. Normally, the cheese is in a small container on the side, especially in an establishment like an airport, but they didn't care when I said I'd rather have it on the side. They were very rude when I complained that I didn't have enough queso for the amount of chips I got, and they continued to said it would be another $5 for more queso! The price was already outrageous so I couldn't justify it. I ate 1/4 of my dish and had to throw out the rest of the overly fried chips. One star only because of the convenience of being next to my gate. Otherwise the customer service is horrible- the ladies look at you like you're bothering them, and roll their eyes when you ask for some napkins! Like it's such an inconvenience. I will not return when I come back to this airport, that's for sure!
Great margaritas,  amazing fish tacos, and quick service for the experienced traveler.

Meals served in elementary school cafeteria trays, the paper under the burritos gets soggy and when you're done you realize you have eaten half of it and the service is incredibly slow. I won't be back.

Cocktails were great, food and service were also great. Recommend the nachos with pork, but be prepared to share. Even the half order is gigantic. Only complaint would be it's incredibly loud inside, and they only have one fan on the patio, which is not enough for the Arizona heat.

We stopped in for a quick beer before our flight. The bar features a large beer selection at pretty reasonable prices. They were served in red solo cups, which was a little odd, but kind of fun at the same time. We ordered from the counter as the bar was full. The beers came quick and the staff was friendly. We didn't try the food, but it looked good and was reasonably priced. We will definitely be back.

Took 15 minutes to get a chicken burrito, and there was no line. There were more people behind the counter than waiting for food. Seriously, this is way too slow for airport food. Food is only so-so - Chipotle is better (and way faster).

I was surprised by how much I liked Sir Veza's Taco Garage. While waiting for my connecting flight from SFO to IND, the Sky Harbor airport didn't seem to have many great options. For so many people on that busy day and in such a tiny airport, every food place seemed packed, including this one... but I followed my instincts and stood in line with my colleague.

Ordering took awhile, but everyone who works here is super friendly. I ended up getting the carnitas bowl. I took my box and found some seats at an adjacent gate since ours was too claustrophobic. With low expectations for airport food, I opened my box and my eyes widened. The juicy carnitas looked so delicious, smothered with vegetables and tons of sour cream, which is my Mexican food weakness. I inhaled the whole thing in less time than it took me to stand in line and get it. 

Though I wouldn't pick this Mexican spot over ones in San Francisco or San Diego, it definitely exceeded my expectations for airport food. Sir Veza's also has a bar area, though it was too crowded to sit there. If I had more time, and if it wasn't first thing in the morning, I would have loved to enjoy a margarita during that layover.
Awesome fish tacos!! Best I've had since leaving San Diego! And the service was friendly and fast. I'll be back!
Good food and service! Worth trying. Looking forward to warmer weather to enjoy the patio.

Being a Mexican snob, I was hesitant to come here. My mantra is "the dirtier the location, the better the food". From the moment I tried the salsa from the chips, I knew that this place was solid. 


Shredded chicken burrito California style. Get that and you won't go wrong.

$20 for a burrito and draft beer, $10 burrito with no sides and $7 beer. The burrito was pretty big for me, however everything was so bland. I had the carne asada and it was overcooked and dry, I had to add 2 sauces packs and a ton of hot sauce to add flavor. For the pros, it is a cool place to hang out if you have a long layover. Food was quick, friendly people, and tv to watch the game. If I was stuck in the terminal I would try again and order something different. Other people's food at the bar looked good.
Bartender is amazing and fun the staff is great. Go check them out when your on your way out of town.

Ok, this is not an ordinary airport restaurant. It's not the fastest service, but it is one of THE BEST fish tacos and the MOST INCREDIBLE green chili and cheese tamales I've ever had. And I've tried both at many, many restaurants. After spending 25 years living in Houston and traveling throughout the U.S. But since this restaurant is located in an airport most people enter with a bad attitude to begin with. The hassle of traveling, long lines, rude people...but people right next door to each other are two little gems in the Phoenix Sky Harbor Headache....Cartel Coffee and Sir Veza's Taco Garage.

Great sides also...guacamole, black beans and Spanish rice. Fish tacos available at breakfast too...big plus.

Decent food but a LONG wait! Avoid this place unless you have a lot of time in the airport! It took me about 30 minutes to get my food and they didn't even start half my order until I complained after 20 minutes! The other half of my order sat on the counter for 10 minutes getting cold!

Customer service manager is extremely rude! After ordering a burrito and a fountain soda I had taken just a couple of sips and got a horrible taste from the unfiltered water that was used for their sodas. It was overwhelmingly bad and frankly undrinkable. I politely went up to ask if the cost of the bottled sodas were the same price because I didn't care for the fountain sodas. I was immediately asked what was wrong and explained that I could tell the water for the fountain was simply tap water and not filtered. If it was going to be an issue I was willing to pay the difference however before I could explain this to the manager, he grabbed the drink from me and threw it in the garbage and said "Just grab whatever from the cooler I don't care".  F&B management is something I do and THIS is definitely not a job for this guy. Bare in mind, my flight was delayed 3 hours and if I can keep my composure, I'm sure after a hard day, this bearded manager can find a way to exercise his patience and utilize his manager and customer service skills. He is setting a horrible example for the younger employees on how to treat customers. Let this behavior slide and your business will have bigger problems on their hands.

Gross! Last time it took 40 min to get my tacos and I didn't have time to eat them. This time I ordered a taco salad and it was disgusting an old. Nothing about it had anything to do with taco, no chips or shell. Will not give them a third chance.

The servers are really nice and friendly, but when it comes to beer selection they don't have that much variety. They have a decent amount of beer somewhat. They only have one type of IPA beer though ):

Really excellent value for cost here, particularly for airport food. I ordered a breakfast bowl ($11) and easily could have shared with my spouse. It came with chips, black beans, eggs, green onions, green olives, chorizo (you select the meat you'd like) and a generous serving of sour cream and guacamole. My husband ordered the nachos - similar price, similar hefty toppings. The food was flavorful and mildly spicy. Again, better than a lot of airport food. The one drawback? There's not nearly enough seating.
Went for taco Tuesday. 50% off! Tacos were delicious and service was great. Definitely would return.
I've only been here once so far but I was pleased. My husband and I had lunch; I had a pork taco and salad while he had a pork carnitas bowl. The wait staff was great. We will go again.

I had the most amazing fish tacos ever!!
First off, they give you plenty of fish on your tacos unlike some places that get stingy with their fish.. They had lots of toppings on them, very flavorful... Probably one of the best fish tacos I've ever had!
As far as the atmosphere... I mean I'm eating at the one in the airport on my journey to Denver... It's not bad for what space they get to work with. 
I would definitely recommend this place to anyone flying or If there is another one is definitely come again!

I had some nachos at the airport before a flight with my son and the cheese sauce served with the chips was absolutely disgusting (and I recently tried Chipotle's new queso so I know the true meaning of abysmal). The Lays brand in the jar in the chip aisle in the grocery store is much, much better. Everyone sitting around us was complaining about their food and throwing it away uneaten. I don't know if this if normal for Sir Veza's or just the airport location but I never eat here again.

After rushing to the airport and through security, we were starving while waiting for our flight.  Luckily, Sir Veza's was in our terminal. They were extremely busy, but it was worth the wait.

I got the veggie soft tacos, with 2 soft tortillas, black beans, rice, guacamole, and veggies. I don't know if my extreme hunger was factor or not, but these tacos were pretty darn delicious.  Like everything in the airport, they were over-priced, but when your options are limited and you didn't come prepared (like me), you'll gladly pay.  

Order at the counter, try to find a seat, and listen for your order number to be called.
Is this place still open? Closed shop with no signage on a Wednesday at 6 PM, stools and chairs put up on tables. Really disappointing.

Worthless piece of crap restrnt around. Staff all have attitude from hell.   Its dirty and food is sparse and marginal.   They advertise 2  tamales for $11.   They are frozen crap served with literally 2 teaspoons of rice and beans.  They charge for xtra sauce. This place is shameful for Sky Harbor Airport.  You are better to wait for peanuts on SWA . Only positive, they give free dink refills.  Just keeping it honest and fair.

Not exactly good.    Some where between bad and a low good.   Had the sliders and they were mystery meat.  Tasteless.  The only thing I could taste was the thousand island dressing. I'm always suspicious of a hamburger that is perfectly round.  But the fries we good.

Weak. I had a layover in the C terminal. I ordered the chips and queso. The chips were stale tasting and often fried together into one big cake. The queso made warmed velveeta seem flavorful. The Scottsdale Blonde was a nice beer. Overall - not a great experience - even for airport food standards.

I love this place! They have the BEST happy hour! Everyday! 

The first time I went to Sir Veza's was in the Tucson location and it was just the worst experience ever. I've also been to the one at the Phoenix airport to grab a drink from time to time. So when this location opened I was hesitant to try it out and I'm so glad I did anyway!  I've tried so many items on their menu!

The sonoran dog is really good. It's a bacon wrapped hot dog, with beans, salsa, tomato, and it comes with fries. I've also had their Johnny Vegas which is really good. The cilantro cream cheese that comes with it is delicious. Now if you ever order their burrito bowls, make sure you are REALLY hungry because this thing is huge! I got the Go Shaker Chimi and couldn't even eat half of it. 

Their margaritas are also really good! and are usually on happy hour. I recommend the strawberry one on the rocks, Get the 14 bomb! 

The customer service has always been good. I love their outdoor patio. It is also dog friendly. (I've taken my little monster with me) And it even has a photobooth! What more can you ask for!

This place is awesome, perfect spot to come to before or movie or even while your shopping at the mall since it's attached to it.   Everytime we been here we been lucky to have the same bartender with the bandana and he's remembered us each time. 

The craft beer lineup is good and full of local breweries and if you want some good tequila shots they got that too.   I recommend the don Julio 1942 it's smooth and hits the spot. 

The food is really good you can't go wrong with anything,  and we showed up on a Sunday and it was happy hour was 3pm to close. 

If your in the area you have to check it out, haven't seen it to packed but real good vibe and friendly staff
The food was pretty basic for Americanized Mexican food. What won me over was the service. Really on top of their game and I truly appreciated it with the accommodations they made.

I had about an hour to spare between early morning flights at Skyharbor and so decided to try out a new place.

I ordered the turkey sausage sliders as I hadn't seen those on a menu before.

I think everything is cooked fresh and so it took a few minutes to prepare (which was fine for me, but if you have to catch a flight that might not be great).

The bread buns were nice a light/fluffy - perhaps like brioche - the turkey sausage was kind of flavourless, the egg "pancake" was terrible, like microwaved frozen eggs terrible I honestly thought it was a pancake at first until I looked at the menu again.  There was some cheese present, but it had no taste.

I added both the salsa they give you and some sriracha I asked for, but nothing could save the sliders.

There was a side of fried potatoes/papas but they were very small pieces and had been overcooked.

Based on this meal I would not eat here again.

What a fun little place at Chandler mall! The food is good and the atmosphere is a lot of fun. We went on a Wednesday afternoon so it wasn't busy at all and we got amazing service from this waitress from Indiana. She knew all about the menu and was really personable 

I ordered the bio bowl which is the vegan option offered on the menu. It is full of veggies, beans, and rice and it really full of flavor. I got it with some red sauce to add a little more depth and flavor. It was really good. 

We also ordered a margarita pitcher which was well made and had chunks of fruit in it. A pitcher will run you about $27 and you'll get 4 drinks out of it total, not bad! They also have Pacifico on tap, which is awesome!

For desert I had the pumpkin tamale which was really good and supposedly vegan. They can also made their brownie desert vegan without an egg, but it takes 15-20 minutes to make. It's nice to see a restaurant catering to their customers. I'll definitely be back!
Came on 4th of July around 3pm. Ordered a frozen Margarita-/watermelon ranchero! Delicious- got an order of the mini chimes! Bomb

This place doesn't even deserve one star. After sitting at our table with no offer for a drink while we wait, we decided to get up and leave and go spend our money at BJ's across the way. Thanks for nothing!
Zero service. Food is given in take out containers. Nachos are served with fake cheese and they do not have jalape√±os.

Came here between flights. Not a bad place to hang out and have a beer, but $10 for a burrito that only has beans, rice and meat? Not worth the money spend for food. Come catch a game between flights and a beer, thats about it.
Pretty good Mexican joint, Arizona-style. Definitely recommend if you're stuck by a delayed flight. Great service and free refills.

Tucson's Savory Invention: The Sonoran Hot Dog!

No need to go to a doguero [hot dog vendor] to get a Sonoran Dog in town.  Sir Veza's serves up their take on the Sonoran called, "El Sirnoran."  El Sirnoran Dog is eight-inches of 100% Angus beef hot dog wrapped in applewood bacon with beans, jalape√±o salsa, and tomatoes topped with a drizzle of mayo and mustard.  Knife and forking this bad boy isn't too embarrassing because holding this wiener to your lips is borderline NSFW but dang is it delicious.  I also tried their flavorful Enchilada Stack with shredded beef and topped with an egg.  I never had enchiladas topped with a fried egg before but I'm not sure I want to eat them without an egg ever again.  The yolk porn... my goodness! For drinks, I got the Mexican Mule which was okay. I liked my friend's Mint Condition Mojito a lot more!

They have an amazing Monday-Saturday Happy Hour menu from 3-7PM and 9PM-close.  I think I'll be back only for their Happy Hour specials.  As for their Sirnoran Dog, as good as it is, I rather get my dogs from a doguero at some local Mexican joints around town.  3.5 stars!

For a reasonably cheap meal in an airport, Sir Veza's gets a FULL FIVE STARS. I had a DELICIOUS salad (hold the rice) that was seriously so good. I traveled for work for a bit of time, and airport food and I just don't love each other. I'm used to wilting lettuce on sandwiches, salads, and plates, and that's just disgusting but sadly expected in airport restaurants under $20/meal. Sir Veza's delivered. They have a small seating area, a quick line, free refills on fountain drinks if you stay in their area to eat, and a small bar with a handful of craft beers on top. If I visit PHX airport again, I'll definitely come back!

Our son just moved to Chandler and over Memorial Weekend our family of 6 decided to go here for dinner.  Were we surprised?? By far the best Mexican restaurant we have ever been too!! Our waiter Marcus was fantastic and the food was awesome!  We all tried something different and we all loved what we got. I ordered the chicken enchilada which was prepared a different way, that I loved!  You've got to order the guacamole because they come to the table to make it, so put everything in it, it's awesome!  Chips & Salsa are good too! We've been back 4 times in just a few short weeks. Can't say enough about this place. Loved it, loved it, loved it!

It was a horrible experience today. We couldn't get the food after waiting for 20 minutes when our flight started boarding. No one told us it would take that long. Several other people could not get there food in time either. Also, they could not refund us because the manager was busy in the kitchen. We ended with no food and no refund when boarding our flight.
Great new concept from Tucson. Same food as el charro but set in casual, comfortable, cantina setting. A must try. Also @ airport

Primarily a drinking place, and even though they have a decent quantity of taps, they don't have very good craft options.

Breakfast was overpriced and very mediocre.  This place plays second fiddle to Los Taquitos in the next row of restaurants over that has much better burritos.
I have to say I wasn't overly fond of their beer selection. I did like their guacamole. They make it at your table and there was lot, but that's not enough to go back for...

When I travel to Phoenix for work I always make it a Point to allow enough time to get to Sir Veza's Taco Garage. This Place is Soooo Good I've even take Taco's Home on occasion. Honestly I found it hard to believe that this Place was only rated at 3 Stars? After reading some of the Reviews It was Clear that These People just don't know what to Order and Apparently have not ever eaten at a Airport and did not know that  Food is Expensive. I love the Design of the place and always enjoy drinking some of the local Craft beer available here. Also the service is always on Point! Thanks Guys, see you next week.

We ordered that carne asada burrito and grilled chicken bowl. The burrito was okay for airport fare although it would absolutely be a crime to purchase for $12 at an actual restaurant outside the airport. Their salsa come in sealed caps like taco bell and taco bell is definitely a better food place compared to this. The chicken bowl is the most repulsive thing I've put in my mouth as far as I can remember. It literally looks and taste like my puke after a long night of binge drinking.

Great service. I had a carne asada bowl and a margarita (forgot name). A must order. Got my food in less then 10 minutes after ordering. Again great fresh food and fairly inexpensive. If you're in chandler this place is a must.

Best veggie tacos I've had in a long time and Chuck was the best bar tender. I told him I liked a less sweet sangria and he replaced my sangria with a larger less sweet glass. The service was great and personal.  The open air was great paired with the mist! I'll be back!
Very mediocre at best. Service was ridiculous. Worst guacamole I ever had. The only good thing was the mango margarita.
Ordered the fish tacos - should call it fish nugget.  For $9 - I got two bites of fish across two tacos.   Ridiculous.

Airport Food - Always a challenge, and the Phoenix Airport Terminal 4 has so many choices. I usually have an hour layover between flights at this American Hub. It is good for me as I can get in a couple of miles walk and if timing is right, even a lunch. I had a couple of chicken tacos.  Simple enough. Very nice. They grilled the onions, peppers and chicken, ha a small cup of black beans and rice, and a spicy salsa. The tacos each had two tortillas, so I halved things and ended up with four tacos and they were all wonderful. This is my new go to place in the Phoenix Sky Harbor in Terminal 4 .
Thank you Sir Veza

Location: it is located in the Chandler mall. It has outdoor and indoor seatings close to the main food court. General areas are relatively clean and organized. However, this restaurant is more family oriented and I probably will not recommend it for a date night. 

Service: it is 120% excellence. The owner basically greed us at the door while we were reviewing the menu. The waitress is super friendly and attentive. After we were seated, the owner still comes back to check up on us from time to time. 

Food: we ordered shrimp ceviche as an appetizer. They put too much lime on it and it was a bit too soar. For main entree, I ordered the Soroman hotdog and it was absolutely delicious. The owner told me he moved out here from Tuson and I'm glad that they bought my favorite hotdog down here with him. I wanted to order the churrios for dessert but I was completely full at that point. 

Rating: I gave it a 3 stars because (1) the comment about the appetizer and (2) their menus are a bit pricy. I might come back here again to get the hotdog. Overall, I think this restaurant is average.
Awful! This is a $12 Asada bowl. About 75% beans. Even at the airport, I'd expect better. Better off at the grab n go...

I tried this place a couple weeks ago. The bartenders and servers here Are attentive and I was treated like family the first time I came in. The food is good atmosphere is great and friendly staff. I will be a regular glad it's in my neighborhood.

This was closest to my gate..and i was feeling hungry..so why not..

I got the overpriced 2 carnitas tacos... Not legit at all..

It was just eh.....

This place was awful. Someone dumped a drink on me because they were wasted and this place continued to serve them. Because she's a woman. This place is sexist. I complained to manager which ignored me. I would never recommend this place.
